values.authorQuote: Make the best use of what is in your power, and take the rest as it happens.
values.author: Epictetus

values.authorQuote: If you want to improve, be content to be thought foolish and stupid.
values.author: Epictetus

values.authorQuote: To accuse others for one's own misfortunes is a sign of want of education. To accuse oneself shows that one's education has begun. To accuse neither oneself nor others shows that one's education is complete.
values.author: Epictetus

values.authorQuote: No man is free who is not master of himself.
values.author: Epictetus

values.authorQuote: Be careful to leave your sons well instructed rather than rich, for the hopes of the instructed are better than the wealth of the ignorant.
values.author: Epictetus

values.authorQuote: Someone who thinks the world is always cheating him is right. He is missing that wonderful feeling of trust in someone or something.
values.author: Eric Hoffer
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: The hardest arithmetic to master is that which enables us to count our blessings.
values.author: Eric Hoffer
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: Propaganda does not deceive people; it merely helps them to deceive themselves.
values.author: Eric Hoffer
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: The only way to predict the future is to have power to shape the future.
values.author: Eric Hoffer
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: One of the marks of a truly vigorous society is the ability to dispense with passion as a midwife of action - the ability to pass directly from thought to action.
values.author: Eric Hoffer
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: People who bite the hand that feeds them usually lick the boot that kicks them.
values.author: Eric Hoffer
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: It is easier to love humanity as a whole than to love one's neighbor.
values.author: Eric Hoffer
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: You can discover what your enemy fears most by observing the means he uses to frighten you.
values.author: Eric Hoffer
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: The pleasure we derive from doing favors is partly in the feeling it gives us that we are not altogether worthless. It is a pleasant surprise to ourselves.
values.author: Eric Hoffer
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: We feel free when we escape - even if it be but from the frying pan to the fire.
values.author: Eric Hoffer
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: Children are the keys of paradise.
values.author: Eric Hoffer
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: Far more crucial than what we know or do not know is what we do not want to know.
values.author: Eric Hoffer
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: In times of change learners inherit the earth; while the learned find themselves beautifully equipped to deal with a world that no longer exists.
values.author: Eric Hoffer
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: Creativity is the ability to introduce order into the randomness of nature.
values.author: Eric Hoffer
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: The fear of becoming a 'has-been' keeps some people from becoming anything.
values.author: Eric Hoffer
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: Disappointment is a sort of bankruptcy - the bankruptcy of a soul that expends too much in hope and expectation.
values.author: Eric Hoffer
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: Social improvement is attained more readily by a concern with the quality of results than with the purity of motives.
values.author: Eric Hoffer
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: Passionate hatred can give meaning and purpose to an empty life.
values.author: Eric Hoffer
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: Faith in a holy cause is to a considerable extent a substitute for lost faith in ourselves.
values.author: Eric Hoffer
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: We can be absolutely certain only about things we do not understand.
values.author: Eric Hoffer
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: The beginning of thought is in disagreement - not only with others but also with ourselves.
values.author: Eric Hoffer
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: It is the child in man that is the source of his uniqueness and creativeness, and the playground is the optimal milieu for the unfolding of his capacities and talents.
values.author: Eric Hoffer
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: I hang onto my prejudices, they are the testicles of my mind.
values.author: Eric Hoffer
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: The misery of a child is interesting to a mother, the misery of a young man is interesting to a young woman, the misery of an old man is interesting to nobody.
values.author: Eric Hoffer
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: Rudeness is a weak imitation of strength.
values.author: Eric Hoffer
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: Many of the insights of the saint stem from their experience as sinners.
values.author: Eric Hoffer
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: There is a thin line that separates laughter and pain, comedy and tragedy, humor and hurt.
values.author: Erma Bombeck

values.authorQuote: When I stand before God at the end of my life, I would hope that I would not have a single bit of talent left, and could say, 'I used everything you gave me'.
values.author: Erma Bombeck

values.authorQuote: Don't confuse fame with success. Madonna is one; Helen Keller is the other.
values.author: Erma Bombeck

values.authorQuote: I come from a family where gravy is considered a beverage.
values.author: Erma Bombeck

values.authorQuote: It is not until you become a mother that your judgment slowly turns to compassion and understanding.
values.author: Erma Bombeck

values.authorQuote: Thanksgiving dinners take eighteen hours to prepare. They are consumed in twelve minutes. Half-times take twelve minutes. This is not coincidence.
values.author: Erma Bombeck

values.authorQuote: There is nothing more miserable in the world than to arrive in paradise and look like your passport photo.
values.author: Erma Bombeck

values.authorQuote: When a child is locked in the bathroom with water running and he says he's doing nothing but the dog is barking, call 911.
values.author: Erma Bombeck

values.authorQuote: The only reason I would take up jogging is so that I could hear heavy breathing again.
values.author: Erma Bombeck

values.authorQuote: I take a very practical view of raising children. I put a sign in each of their rooms: 'Checkout Time is 18 years.'
values.author: Erma Bombeck

values.authorQuote: One thing they never tell you about child raising is that for the rest of your life, at the drop of a hat, you are expected to know your child's name and how old he or she is.
values.author: Erma Bombeck

values.authorQuote: Never go to a doctor whose office plants have died.
values.author: Erma Bombeck

values.authorQuote: If you can't make it better, you can laugh at it.
values.author: Erma Bombeck

values.authorQuote: When your mother asks, 'Do you want a piece of advice?' it is a mere formality. It doesn't matter if you answer yes or no. You're going to get it anyway.
values.author: Erma Bombeck

values.authorQuote: Do you know what you call those who use towels and never wash them, eat meals and never do the dishes, sit in rooms they never clean, and are entertained till they drop? If you have just answered, 'A house guest,' you're wrong because I have just described my kids.
values.author: Erma Bombeck

values.authorQuote: Once you get a spice in your home, you have it forever. Women never throw out spices. The Egyptians were buried with their spices. I know which one I'm taking with me when I go.
values.author: Erma Bombeck

values.authorQuote: I haven't trusted polls since I read that 62% of women had affairs during their lunch hour. I've never met a woman in my life who would give up lunch for sex.
values.author: Erma Bombeck

values.authorQuote: God created man, but I could do better.
values.author: Erma Bombeck

values.authorQuote: Children make your life important.
values.author: Erma Bombeck

values.authorQuote: When humor goes, there goes civilization.
values.author: Erma Bombeck

values.authorQuote: There's nothing sadder in this world than to awake Christmas morning and not be a child.
values.author: Erma Bombeck

values.authorQuote: For years my wedding ring has done its job. It has led me not into temptation. It has reminded my husband numerous times at parties that it's time to go home. It has been a source of relief to a dinner companion. It has been a status symbol in the maternity ward.
values.author: Erma Bombeck

values.authorQuote: Never have more children than you have car windows.
values.author: Erma Bombeck

values.authorQuote: Thanks to my mother, not a single cardboard box has found its way back into society. We receive gifts in boxes from stores that went out of business twenty years ago.
values.author: Erma Bombeck

values.authorQuote: It takes a lot of courage to show your dreams to someone else.
values.author: Erma Bombeck

values.authorQuote: A grandmother pretends she doesn't know who you are on Halloween.
values.author: Erma Bombeck

values.authorQuote: The best way to find out if you can trust somebody is to trust them.
values.author: Ernest Hemingway

values.authorQuote: The world breaks everyone, and afterward, some are strong at the broken places.
values.author: Ernest Hemingway

values.authorQuote: Never go on trips with anyone you do not love.
values.author: Ernest Hemingway

values.authorQuote: I love sleep. My life has the tendency to fall apart when I'm awake, you know?
values.author: Ernest Hemingway

values.authorQuote: An intelligent man is sometimes forced to be drunk to spend time with his fools.
values.author: Ernest Hemingway

values.authorQuote: I like to listen. I have learned a great deal from listening carefully. Most people never listen.
values.author: Ernest Hemingway

values.authorQuote: Courage is grace under pressure.
values.author: Ernest Hemingway

values.authorQuote: There is nothing noble in being superior to your fellow men. True nobility lies in being superior to your former self.
values.author: Ernest Hemingway

values.authorQuote: Happiness in intelligent people is the rarest thing I know.
values.author: Ernest Hemingway

values.authorQuote: Every man's life ends the same way. It is only the details of how he lived and how he died that distinguish one man from another.
values.author: Ernest Hemingway

values.authorQuote: From things that have happened and from things as they exist and from all things that you know and all those you cannot know, you make something through your invention that is not a representation but a whole new thing truer than anything true and alive, and you make it alive, and if you make it well enough, you give it immortality.
values.author: Ernest Hemingway

values.authorQuote: There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed.
values.author: Ernest Hemingway

values.authorQuote: Man is not made for defeat.
values.author: Ernest Hemingway

values.authorQuote: For a true writer, each book should be a new beginning where he tries again for something that is beyond attainment. He should always try for something that has never been done or that others have tried and failed. Then sometimes, with great luck, he will succeed.
values.author: Ernest Hemingway

values.authorQuote: Always do sober what you said you'd do drunk. That will teach you to keep your mouth shut.
values.author: Ernest Hemingway

values.authorQuote: I love to go to the zoo. But not on Sunday. I don't like to see the people making fun of the animals, when it should be the other way around.
values.author: Ernest Hemingway

values.authorQuote: I never had to choose a subject - my subject rather chose me.
values.author: Ernest Hemingway

values.authorQuote: But man is not made for defeat. A man can be destroyed but not defeated.
values.author: Ernest Hemingway

values.authorQuote: We are all apprentices in a craft where no one ever becomes a master.
values.author: Ernest Hemingway

values.authorQuote: I know war as few other men now living know it, and nothing to me is more revolting. I have long advocated its complete abolition, as its very destructiveness on both friend and foe has rendered it useless as a method of settling international disputes.
values.author: Ernest Hemingway

values.authorQuote: The world is a fine place and worth the fighting for and I hate very much to leave it.
values.author: Ernest Hemingway

values.authorQuote: All things truly wicked start from innocence.
values.author: Ernest Hemingway

values.authorQuote: There is no lonelier man in death, except the suicide, than that man who has lived many years with a good wife and then outlived her. If two people love each other there can be no happy end to it.
values.author: Ernest Hemingway

values.authorQuote: Never mistake motion for action.
values.author: Ernest Hemingway

values.authorQuote: Never think that war, no matter how necessary, nor how justified, is not a crime.
values.author: Ernest Hemingway

values.authorQuote: I'm not going to get into the ring with Tolstoy.
values.author: Ernest Hemingway

values.authorQuote: Personality is an unbroken series of successful gestures.
values.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

values.authorQuote: Genius is the ability to put into effect what is on your mind.
values.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

values.authorQuote: Show me a hero and I'll write you a tragedy.
values.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

values.authorQuote: There are only the pursued, the pursuing, the busy and the tired.
values.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

values.authorQuote: You don't write because you want to say something, you write because you have something to say.
values.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

values.authorQuote: A great social success is a pretty girl who plays her cards as carefully as if she were plain.
values.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

values.authorQuote: All good writing is swimming under water and holding your breath.
values.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

values.authorQuote: Never confuse a single defeat with a final defeat.
values.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

values.authorQuote: Everybody's youth is a dream, a form of chemical madness.
values.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

values.authorQuote: First you take a drink, then the drink takes a drink, then the drink takes you.
values.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

values.authorQuote: Vitality shows in not only the ability to persist but the ability to start over.
values.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

values.authorQuote: It is sadder to find the past again and find it inadequate to the present than it is to have it elude you and remain forever a harmonious conception of memory.
values.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

values.authorQuote: Life is essentially a cheat and its conditions are those of defeat; the redeeming things are not happiness and pleasure but the deeper satisfactions that come out of struggle.
values.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

values.authorQuote: It is in the thirties that we want friends. In the forties we know they won't save us any more than love did.
values.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

values.authorQuote: Great art is the contempt of a great man for small art.
values.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

values.authorQuote: Family quarrels are bitter things. They don't go according to any rules. They're not like aches or wounds, they're more like splits in the skin that won't heal because there's not enough material.
values.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

values.authorQuote: After all, life hasn't much to offer except youth, and I suppose for older people, the love of youth in others.
values.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

values.authorQuote: I'm a romantic; a sentimental person thinks things will last, a romantic person hopes against hope that they won't.
values.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

values.authorQuote: I like people and I like them to like me, but I wear my heart where God put it, on the inside.
values.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

values.authorQuote: Nothing is as obnoxious as other people's luck.
values.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

values.authorQuote: To write it, it took three months; to conceive it three minutes; to collect the data in it all my life.
values.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

values.authorQuote: The idea that to make a man work you've got to hold gold in front of his eyes is a growth, not an axiom. We've done that for so long that we've forgotten there's any other way.
values.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

values.authorQuote: Her body calculated to a millimeter to suggest a bud yet guarantee a flower.
values.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

values.authorQuote: Either you think, or else others have to think for you and take power from you, pervert and discipline your natural tastes, civilize and sterilize you.
values.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

values.authorQuote: His was a great sin who first invented consciousness. Let us lose it for a few hours.
values.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

values.authorQuote: The world, as a rule, does not live on beaches and in country clubs.
values.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

values.authorQuote: They talk about the failure of socialism but where is the success of capitalism in Africa, Asia and Latin America?
values.author: Fidel Castro
values.authorOccupation: President of Cuba, communist revolutionary, politician

values.authorQuote: The equal right of all citizens to health, education, work, food, security, culture, science, and wellbeing - that is, the same rights we proclaimed when we began our struggle, in addition to those which emerge from our dreams of justice and equality for all inhabitants of our world - is what I wish for all.
values.author: Fidel Castro
values.authorOccupation: President of Cuba, communist revolutionary, politician

values.authorQuote: The revolution is a dictatorship of the exploited against the exploiters.
values.author: Fidel Castro
values.authorOccupation: President of Cuba, communist revolutionary, politician

values.authorQuote: I became a Communist by studying capitalist political economy, and when I had some understanding of that problem, it actually seemed to me so absurd, so irrational, so inhuman, that I simply began to elaborate on my own formulas for production and distribution.
values.author: Fidel Castro
values.authorOccupation: President of Cuba, communist revolutionary, politician

values.authorQuote: I find capitalism repugnant. It is filthy, it is gross, it is alienating... because it causes war, hypocrisy and competition.
values.author: Fidel Castro
values.authorOccupation: President of Cuba, communist revolutionary, politician

values.authorQuote: I began revolution with 82 men. If I had to do it again, I do it with 10 or 15 and absolute faith. It does not matter how small you are if you have faith and plan of action.
values.author: Fidel Castro
values.authorOccupation: President of Cuba, communist revolutionary, politician

values.authorQuote: I would not vote for the mayor. It's not just because he didn't invite me to dinner, but because on my way into town from the airport there were such enormous potholes.
values.author: Fidel Castro
values.authorOccupation: President of Cuba, communist revolutionary, politician

values.authorQuote: I can assure you that my first and foremost interest is my country.
values.author: Fidel Castro
values.authorOccupation: President of Cuba, communist revolutionary, politician

values.authorQuote: I don't think anyone has been slandered more than the Jews.
values.author: Fidel Castro
values.authorOccupation: President of Cuba, communist revolutionary, politician

values.authorQuote: I never saw a contradiction between the ideas that sustain me and the ideas of that symbol, of that extraordinary figure, Jesus Christ.
values.author: Fidel Castro
values.authorOccupation: President of Cuba, communist revolutionary, politician

values.authorQuote: Someday, the capitalist system will disappear in the United States, because no social class system has been eternal. One day, class societies will disappear.
values.author: Fidel Castro
values.authorOccupation: President of Cuba, communist revolutionary, politician

values.authorQuote: I am not a communist and neither is the revolutionary movement.
values.author: Fidel Castro
values.authorOccupation: President of Cuba, communist revolutionary, politician

values.authorQuote: A revolution is not a bed of roses.
values.author: Fidel Castro
values.authorOccupation: President of Cuba, communist revolutionary, politician

values.authorQuote: Capitalism is using its money; we socialists throw it away.
values.author: Fidel Castro
values.authorOccupation: President of Cuba, communist revolutionary, politician

values.authorQuote: I am a Marxist Leninist and I will be one until the last day of my life.
values.author: Fidel Castro
values.authorOccupation: President of Cuba, communist revolutionary, politician

values.authorQuote: The revenues of Cuban state-run companies are used exclusively for the benefit of the people, to whom they belong.
values.author: Fidel Castro
values.authorOccupation: President of Cuba, communist revolutionary, politician

values.authorQuote: A revolution is a struggle to the death between the future and the past.
values.author: Fidel Castro
values.authorOccupation: President of Cuba, communist revolutionary, politician

values.authorQuote: How can we help President Obama?
values.author: Fidel Castro
values.authorOccupation: President of Cuba, communist revolutionary, politician

values.authorQuote: I have always fought for concrete facts, for justice.
values.author: Fidel Castro
values.authorOccupation: President of Cuba, communist revolutionary, politician

values.authorQuote: More than 820 million people in the world suffer from hunger; and 790 million of them live in the Third World.
values.author: Fidel Castro
values.authorOccupation: President of Cuba, communist revolutionary, politician

values.authorQuote: Condemn me. It does not matter. History will absolve me.
values.author: Fidel Castro
values.authorOccupation: President of Cuba, communist revolutionary, politician

values.authorQuote: I think that a man should not live beyond the age when he begins to deteriorate, when the flame that lighted the brightest moment of his life has weakened.
values.author: Fidel Castro
values.authorOccupation: President of Cuba, communist revolutionary, politician

values.authorQuote: The fact is, when men carry the same ideals in their hearts, nothing can isolate them - neither prison walls nor the sod of cemeteries. For a single memory, a single spirit, a single idea, a single conscience, a single dignity will sustain them all.
values.author: Fidel Castro
values.authorOccupation: President of Cuba, communist revolutionary, politician

values.authorQuote: Nothing in the world is irreversible, not even capitalism.
values.author: Fidel Castro
values.authorOccupation: President of Cuba, communist revolutionary, politician

values.authorQuote: No thieves, no traitors, no interventionists! This time the revolution is for real!
values.author: Fidel Castro
values.authorOccupation: President of Cuba, communist revolutionary, politician

values.authorQuote: I attribute my success to this - I never gave or took any excuse.
values.author: Florence Nightingale
values.authorOccupation: Social reformer, statistician, founder of modern nursing

values.authorQuote: Live your life while you have it. Life is a splendid gift. There is nothing small in it. Far the greatest things grow by God's law out of the smallest. But to live your life, you must discipline it.
values.author: Florence Nightingale
values.authorOccupation: Social reformer, statistician, founder of modern nursing

values.authorQuote: The greatest heroes are those who do their duty in the daily grind of domestic affairs whilst the world whirls as a maddening dreidel.
values.author: Florence Nightingale
values.authorOccupation: Social reformer, statistician, founder of modern nursing

values.authorQuote: The most important practical lesson that can be given to nurses is to teach them what to observe - how to observe - what symptoms indicate improvement - what the reverse - which are of importance - which are of none - which are the evidence of neglect - and of what kind of neglect.
values.author: Florence Nightingale
values.authorOccupation: Social reformer, statistician, founder of modern nursing

values.authorQuote: If a patient is cold, if a patient is feverish, if a patient is faint, if he is sick after taking food, if he has a bed-sore, it is generally the fault not of the disease, but of the nursing.
values.author: Florence Nightingale
values.authorOccupation: Social reformer, statistician, founder of modern nursing

values.authorQuote: If I could give you information of my life, it would be to show how a woman of very ordinary ability has been led by God in strange and unaccustomed paths to do In His service what He has done in her. And if I could tell you all, you would see how God has done all, and I nothing.
values.author: Florence Nightingale
values.authorOccupation: Social reformer, statistician, founder of modern nursing

values.authorQuote: How very little can be done under the spirit of fear.
values.author: Florence Nightingale
values.authorOccupation: Social reformer, statistician, founder of modern nursing

values.authorQuote: Every nurse ought to be careful to wash her hands very frequently during the day. If her face, too, so much the better.
values.author: Florence Nightingale
values.authorOccupation: Social reformer, statistician, founder of modern nursing

values.authorQuote: It may seem a strange principle to enunciate as the very first requirement in a hospital that it should do the sick no harm.
values.author: Florence Nightingale
values.authorOccupation: Social reformer, statistician, founder of modern nursing

values.authorQuote: Badly constructed houses do for the healthy what badly constructed hospitals do for the sick. Once insure that the air in a house is stagnant, and sickness is certain to follow.
values.author: Florence Nightingale
values.authorOccupation: Social reformer, statistician, founder of modern nursing

values.authorQuote: I think one's feelings waste themselves in words; they ought all to be distilled into actions which bring results.
values.author: Florence Nightingale
values.authorOccupation: Social reformer, statistician, founder of modern nursing

values.authorQuote: Were there none who were discontented with what they have, the world would never reach anything better.
values.author: Florence Nightingale
values.authorOccupation: Social reformer, statistician, founder of modern nursing

values.authorQuote: God spoke to me and called me to His Service. What form this service was to take the voice did not say.
values.author: Florence Nightingale
values.authorOccupation: Social reformer, statistician, founder of modern nursing

values.authorQuote: The martyr sacrifices themselves entirely in vain. Or rather not in vain; for they make the selfish more selfish, the lazy more lazy, the narrow narrower.
values.author: Florence Nightingale
values.authorOccupation: Social reformer, statistician, founder of modern nursing

values.authorQuote: So never lose an opportunity of urging a practical beginning, however small, for it is wonderful how often in such matters the mustard-seed germinates and roots itself.
values.author: Florence Nightingale
values.authorOccupation: Social reformer, statistician, founder of modern nursing

values.authorQuote: Never speak to an invalid from behind, nor from the door, nor from any distance from him, nor when he is doing anything. The official politeness of servants in these things is so grateful to invalids, that many prefer, without knowing why, having none but servants about them.
values.author: Florence Nightingale
values.authorOccupation: Social reformer, statistician, founder of modern nursing

values.authorQuote: The very elements of what constitutes good nursing are as little understood for the well as for the sick. The same laws of health or of nursing, for they are in reality the same, obtain among the well as among the sick.
values.author: Florence Nightingale
values.authorOccupation: Social reformer, statistician, founder of modern nursing

values.authorQuote: Women have no sympathy and my experience of women is almost as large as Europe.
values.author: Florence Nightingale
values.authorOccupation: Social reformer, statistician, founder of modern nursing

values.authorQuote: Do not meet or overtake a patient who is moving about in order to speak to him or to give him any message or letter. You might just as well give him a box on the ear. I have seen a patient fall flat on the ground who was standing when his nurse came into the room.
values.author: Florence Nightingale
values.authorOccupation: Social reformer, statistician, founder of modern nursing

values.authorQuote: A hundred struggle and drown in the breakers. One discovers the new world. But rather, ten times rather, die in the surf, heralding the way to that new world, than stand idly on the shore.
values.author: Florence Nightingale
values.authorOccupation: Social reformer, statistician, founder of modern nursing

values.authorQuote: Why do people sit up so late, or, more rarely, get up so early? Not because the day is not long enough, but because they have no time in the day to themselves.
values.author: Florence Nightingale
values.authorOccupation: Social reformer, statistician, founder of modern nursing

values.authorQuote: She said the object and color in the materials around us actually have a physical effect on us, on how we feel.
values.author: Florence Nightingale
values.authorOccupation: Social reformer, statistician, founder of modern nursing

values.authorQuote: I have lived and slept in the same bed with English countesses and Prussian farm women... no woman has excited passions among women more than I have.
values.author: Florence Nightingale
values.authorOccupation: Social reformer, statistician, founder of modern nursing

values.authorQuote: Wise and humane management of the patient is the best safeguard against infection.
values.author: Florence Nightingale
values.authorOccupation: Social reformer, statistician, founder of modern nursing

values.authorQuote: Sick children, if not too shy to speak, will always express this wish. They invariably prefer a story to be told to them, rather than read to them.
values.author: Florence Nightingale
values.authorOccupation: Social reformer, statistician, founder of modern nursing

values.authorQuote: A dark house is always an unhealthy house, always an ill-aired house, always a dirty house. Want of light stops growth and promotes scrofula, rickets, etc., among the children. People lose their health in a dark house, and if they get ill, they cannot get well again in it.
values.author: Florence Nightingale
values.authorOccupation: Social reformer, statistician, founder of modern nursing

values.authorQuote: In order for the light to shine so brightly, the darkness must be present.
values.author: Francis Bacon
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, statesman, scientist, jurist, orator, author

values.authorQuote: Age appears to be best in four things; old wood best to burn, old wine to drink, old friends to trust, and old authors to read.
values.author: Francis Bacon
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, statesman, scientist, jurist, orator, author

values.authorQuote: Travel, in the younger sort, is a part of education; in the elder, a part of experience.
values.author: Francis Bacon
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, statesman, scientist, jurist, orator, author

values.authorQuote: Knowledge is power.
values.author: Francis Bacon
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, statesman, scientist, jurist, orator, author

values.authorQuote: A bachelor's life is a fine breakfast, a flat lunch, and a miserable dinner.
values.author: Francis Bacon
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, statesman, scientist, jurist, orator, author

values.authorQuote: There is a difference between happiness and wisdom: he that thinks himself the happiest man is really so; but he that thinks himself the wisest is generally the greatest fool.
values.author: Francis Bacon
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, statesman, scientist, jurist, orator, author

values.authorQuote: God Almighty first planted a garden. And indeed, it is the purest of human pleasures.
values.author: Francis Bacon
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, statesman, scientist, jurist, orator, author

values.authorQuote: Hope is a good breakfast, but it is a bad supper.
values.author: Francis Bacon
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, statesman, scientist, jurist, orator, author

values.authorQuote: We cannot command Nature except by obeying her.
values.author: Francis Bacon
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, statesman, scientist, jurist, orator, author

values.authorQuote: A man that studieth revenge keeps his own wounds green.
values.author: Francis Bacon
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, statesman, scientist, jurist, orator, author

values.authorQuote: Certainly, in taking revenge, a man is but even with his enemy, but in passing it over, he is superior; for it is a prince's part to pardon.
values.author: Francis Bacon
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, statesman, scientist, jurist, orator, author

values.authorQuote: Discretion of speech is more than eloquence, and to speak agreeably to him with whom we deal is more than to speak in good words, or in good order.
values.author: Francis Bacon
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, statesman, scientist, jurist, orator, author

values.authorQuote: Natural abilities are like natural plants, that need pruning by study; and studies themselves do give forth directions too much at large, except they be bounded in by experience.
values.author: Francis Bacon
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, statesman, scientist, jurist, orator, author

values.authorQuote: Some books are to be tasted, others to be swallowed, and some few to be chewed and digested.
values.author: Francis Bacon
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, statesman, scientist, jurist, orator, author

values.authorQuote: Friends are thieves of time.
values.author: Francis Bacon
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, statesman, scientist, jurist, orator, author

values.authorQuote: Truth is so hard to tell, it sometimes needs fiction to make it plausible.
values.author: Francis Bacon
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, statesman, scientist, jurist, orator, author

values.authorQuote: God hangs the greatest weights upon the smallest wires.
values.author: Francis Bacon
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, statesman, scientist, jurist, orator, author

values.authorQuote: Nature is often hidden, sometimes overcome, seldom extinguished.
values.author: Francis Bacon
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, statesman, scientist, jurist, orator, author

values.authorQuote: The momentous thing in human life is the art of winning the soul to good or evil.
values.author: Francis Bacon
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, statesman, scientist, jurist, orator, author

values.authorQuote: There is no comparison between that which is lost by not succeeding and that which is lost by not trying.
values.author: Francis Bacon
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, statesman, scientist, jurist, orator, author

values.authorQuote: Reading maketh a full man; conference a ready man; and writing an exact man.
values.author: Francis Bacon
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, statesman, scientist, jurist, orator, author

values.authorQuote: Fortitude is the marshal of thought, the armor of the will, and the fort of reason.
values.author: Francis Bacon
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, statesman, scientist, jurist, orator, author

values.authorQuote: The best part of beauty is that which no picture can express.
values.author: Francis Bacon
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, statesman, scientist, jurist, orator, author

values.authorQuote: People usually think according to their inclinations, speak according to their learning and ingrained opinions, but generally act according to custom.
values.author: Francis Bacon
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, statesman, scientist, jurist, orator, author

values.authorQuote: Read not to contradict and confute, nor to believe and take for granted... but to weigh and consider.
values.author: Francis Bacon
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, statesman, scientist, jurist, orator, author

values.authorQuote: Wise men make more opportunities than they find.
values.author: Francis Bacon
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, statesman, scientist, jurist, orator, author

values.authorQuote: Start by doing what's necessary; then do what's possible; and suddenly you are doing the impossible.
values.author: Francis of Assisi
values.authorBirthplace: Assisi, Duchy of Spoleto, Holy Roman Empire

values.authorQuote: Lord, make me an instrument of thy peace. Where there is hatred, let me sow love.
values.author: Francis of Assisi
values.authorBirthplace: Assisi, Duchy of Spoleto, Holy Roman Empire

values.authorQuote: It is no use walking anywhere to preach unless our walking is our preaching.
values.author: Francis of Assisi
values.authorBirthplace: Assisi, Duchy of Spoleto, Holy Roman Empire

values.authorQuote: Where there is charity and wisdom, there is neither fear nor ignorance.
values.author: Francis of Assisi
values.authorBirthplace: Assisi, Duchy of Spoleto, Holy Roman Empire

values.authorQuote: Praised be You, my Lord, through Sister Moon and the stars; in the heavens, you have made them bright, precious and fair.
values.author: Francis of Assisi
values.authorBirthplace: Assisi, Duchy of Spoleto, Holy Roman Empire

values.authorQuote: A single sunbeam is enough to drive away many shadows.
values.author: Francis of Assisi
values.authorBirthplace: Assisi, Duchy of Spoleto, Holy Roman Empire

values.authorQuote: Men lose all the material things they leave behind them in this world, but they carry with them the reward of their charity and the alms they give. For these, they will receive from the Lord the reward and recompense they deserve.
values.author: Francis of Assisi
values.authorBirthplace: Assisi, Duchy of Spoleto, Holy Roman Empire

values.authorQuote: If God can work through me, he can work through anyone.
values.author: Francis of Assisi
values.authorBirthplace: Assisi, Duchy of Spoleto, Holy Roman Empire

values.authorQuote: While you are proclaiming peace with your lips, be careful to have it even more fully in your heart.
values.author: Francis of Assisi
values.authorBirthplace: Assisi, Duchy of Spoleto, Holy Roman Empire

values.authorQuote: Where there is injury let me sow pardon.
values.author: Francis of Assisi
values.authorBirthplace: Assisi, Duchy of Spoleto, Holy Roman Empire

values.authorQuote: Above all the grace and the gifts that Christ gives to his beloved is that of overcoming self.
values.author: Francis of Assisi
values.authorBirthplace: Assisi, Duchy of Spoleto, Holy Roman Empire

values.authorQuote: We must not be wise and prudent according to the flesh. Rather, we must be simple, humble and pure.
values.author: Francis of Assisi
values.authorBirthplace: Assisi, Duchy of Spoleto, Holy Roman Empire

values.authorQuote: We should never desire to be over others. Instead, we ought to be servants who are submissive to every human being for God's sake.
values.author: Francis of Assisi
values.authorBirthplace: Assisi, Duchy of Spoleto, Holy Roman Empire

values.authorQuote: The Father willed that his blessed and glorious Son, whom he gave to us and who was born for us, should through his own blood offer himself as a sacrificial victim on the altar of the cross. This was to be done not for himself through whom all things were made, but for our sins.
values.author: Francis of Assisi
values.authorBirthplace: Assisi, Duchy of Spoleto, Holy Roman Empire

values.authorQuote: Lord, grant that I might not so much seek to be loved as to love.
values.author: Francis of Assisi
values.authorBirthplace: Assisi, Duchy of Spoleto, Holy Roman Empire

values.authorQuote: Great and glorious God, and Thou Lord Jesus, I pray you shed abroad your light in the darkness of my mind. Be found of me, Lord, so that in all things I may act only in accordance with Thy holy will.
values.author: Francis of Assisi
values.authorBirthplace: Assisi, Duchy of Spoleto, Holy Roman Empire

values.authorQuote: If you have men who will exclude any of God's creatures from the shelter of compassion and pity, you will have men who will deal likewise with their fellow men.
values.author: Francis of Assisi
values.authorBirthplace: Assisi, Duchy of Spoleto, Holy Roman Empire

values.authorQuote: For it is in giving that we receive.
values.author: Francis of Assisi
values.authorBirthplace: Assisi, Duchy of Spoleto, Holy Roman Empire

values.authorQuote: Grant me the treasure of sublime poverty: permit the distinctive sign of our order to be that it does not possess anything of its own beneath the sun, for the glory of your name, and that it have no other patrimony than begging.
values.author: Francis of Assisi
values.authorBirthplace: Assisi, Duchy of Spoleto, Holy Roman Empire

values.authorQuote: No one is to be called an enemy, all are your benefactors, and no one does you harm. You have no enemy except yourselves.
values.author: Francis of Assisi
values.authorBirthplace: Assisi, Duchy of Spoleto, Holy Roman Empire

values.authorQuote: Praised be You, my Lord, through our Sister, Mother Earth, who sustains and governs us, producing varied fruits with coloured flowers and herbs.
values.author: Francis of Assisi
values.authorBirthplace: Assisi, Duchy of Spoleto, Holy Roman Empire

values.authorQuote: It is not fitting, when one is in God's service, to have a gloomy face or a chilling look.
values.author: Francis of Assisi
values.authorBirthplace: Assisi, Duchy of Spoleto, Holy Roman Empire

values.authorQuote: It is in pardoning that we are pardoned.
values.author: Francis of Assisi
values.authorBirthplace: Assisi, Duchy of Spoleto, Holy Roman Empire

values.authorQuote: Pure, holy simplicity confounds all the wisdom of this world and the wisdom of the flesh.
values.author: Francis of Assisi
values.authorBirthplace: Assisi, Duchy of Spoleto, Holy Roman Empire

values.authorQuote: Woe to those who die in mortal sin!
values.author: Francis of Assisi
values.authorBirthplace: Assisi, Duchy of Spoleto, Holy Roman Empire

values.authorQuote: If a superior give any order to one who is under him which is against that man's conscience, although he do not obey it yet he shall not be dismissed.
values.author: Francis of Assisi
values.authorBirthplace: Assisi, Duchy of Spoleto, Holy Roman Empire

values.authorQuote: The truth is more important than the facts.
values.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

values.authorQuote: Study nature, love nature, stay close to nature. It will never fail you.
values.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

values.authorQuote: The mother art is architecture. Without an architecture of our own we have no soul of our own civilization.
values.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

values.authorQuote: The longer I live, the more beautiful life becomes.
values.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

values.authorQuote: Simplicity and repose are the qualities that measure the true value of any work of art.
values.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

values.authorQuote: No stream rises higher than its source. What ever man might build could never express or reflect more than he was. He could record neither more nor less than he had learned of life when the buildings were built.
values.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

values.authorQuote: No house should ever be on a hill or on anything. It should be of the hill. Belonging to it. Hill and house should live together each the happier for the other.
values.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

values.authorQuote: Television is chewing gum for the eyes.
values.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

values.authorQuote: There is nothing more uncommon than common sense.
values.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

values.authorQuote: Eventually, I think Chicago will be the most beautiful great city left in the world.
values.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

values.authorQuote: Early in life I had to choose between honest arrogance and hypocritical humility. I chose the former and have seen no reason to change.
values.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

values.authorQuote: A doctor can bury his mistakes but an architect can only advise his clients to plant vines.
values.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

values.authorQuote: I have been black and blue in some spot, somewhere, almost all my life from too intimate contacts with my own furniture.
values.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

values.authorQuote: Form follows function - that has been misunderstood. Form and function should be one, joined in a spiritual union.
values.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

values.authorQuote: I believe in God, only I spell it Nature.
values.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

values.authorQuote: Every great architect is - necessarily - a great poet. He must be a great original interpreter of his time, his day, his age.
values.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

values.authorQuote: The architect must be a prophet... a prophet in the true sense of the term... if he can't see at least ten years ahead don't call him an architect.
values.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

values.authorQuote: The thing always happens that you really believe in; and the belief in a thing makes it happen.
values.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

values.authorQuote: Organic buildings are the strength and lightness of the spiders' spinning, buildings qualified by light, bred by native character to environment, married to the ground.
values.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

values.authorQuote: A free America... means just this: individual freedom for all, rich or poor, or else this system of government we call democracy is only an expedient to enslave man to the machine and make him like it.
values.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

values.authorQuote: The space within becomes the reality of the building.
values.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

values.authorQuote: Less is only more where more is no good.
values.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

values.authorQuote: The architect should strive continually to simplify; the ensemble of the rooms should then be carefully considered that comfort and utility may go hand in hand with beauty.
values.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

values.authorQuote: A great architect is not made by way of a brain nearly so much as he is made by way of a cultivated, enriched heart.
values.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

values.authorQuote: Get the habit of analysis - analysis will in time enable synthesis to become your habit of mind.
values.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

values.authorQuote: The present is the ever moving shadow that divides yesterday from tomorrow. In that lies hope.
values.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

values.authorQuote: Alcohol may be man's worst enemy, but the bible says love your enemy.
values.author: Frank Sinatra

values.authorQuote: The best revenge is massive success.
values.author: Frank Sinatra

values.authorQuote: I'm for whatever gets you through the night.
values.author: Frank Sinatra

values.authorQuote: Cock your hat - angles are attitudes.
values.author: Frank Sinatra

values.authorQuote: I'm not one of those complicated, mixed-up cats. I'm not looking for the secret to life... I just go on from day to day, taking what comes.
values.author: Frank Sinatra

values.authorQuote: I would like to be remembered as a man who had a wonderful time living life, a man who had good friends, fine family - and I don't think I could ask for anything more than that, actually.
values.author: Frank Sinatra

values.authorQuote: You gotta love livin', baby, 'cause dyin' is a pain in the ass.
values.author: Frank Sinatra

values.authorQuote: You treat a lady like a dame, and a dame like a lady.
values.author: Frank Sinatra

values.authorQuote: I like intelligent women. When you go out, it shouldn't be a staring contest.
values.author: Frank Sinatra

values.authorQuote: Don't get even, get mad.
values.author: Frank Sinatra

values.authorQuote: Dare to wear the foolish clown face.
values.author: Frank Sinatra

values.authorQuote: I'm like Albert Schweitzer and Bertrand Russell and Albert Einstein in that I have a respect for life - in any form. I believe in nature, in the birds, the sea, the sky, in everything I can see or that there is real evidence for. If these things are what you mean by God, then I believe in God.
values.author: Frank Sinatra

values.authorQuote: Nothing anybody's said or written about me ever bothers me, except when it does.
values.author: Frank Sinatra

values.authorQuote: I believe that God knows what each of us wants and needs. It's not necessary for us to make it to church on Sunday to reach Him. You can find Him anyplace. And if that sounds heretical, my source is pretty good: Matthew, Five to Seven, The Sermon on the Mount.
values.author: Frank Sinatra

values.authorQuote: Whatever else has been said about me personally is unimportant. When I sing, I believe. I'm honest.
values.author: Frank Sinatra

values.authorQuote: A man doesn't know what happiness is until he's married. By then, it's too late.
values.author: Frank Sinatra

values.authorQuote: I'm gonna live till I die.
values.author: Frank Sinatra

values.authorQuote: I am a thing of beauty.
values.author: Frank Sinatra

values.authorQuote: What I do with my life is of my own doing. I live it the best way I can. I've been criticized on many, many occasions, because of - acquaintances, and what have you.
values.author: Frank Sinatra

values.authorQuote: Oh, I just wish someone would try to hurt you so I could kill them for you.
values.author: Frank Sinatra

values.authorQuote: Hell hath no fury like a hustler with a literary agent.
values.author: Frank Sinatra

values.authorQuote: May you live to be 100 and may the last voice you hear be mine.
values.author: Frank Sinatra

values.authorQuote: People often remark that I'm pretty lucky. Luck is only important in so far as getting the chance to sell yourself at the right moment. After that, you've got to have talent and know how to use it.
values.author: Frank Sinatra

values.authorQuote: For my money, Tony Bennett is the best singer in the business. He excites me when I watch him. He moves me. He's the singer who gets across what the composer has in mind, and probably a little more.
values.author: Frank Sinatra

values.authorQuote: Basically, I'm for anything that gets you through the night - be it prayer, tranquilizers or a bottle of Jack Daniels.
values.author: Frank Sinatra

values.authorQuote: There are things about organized religion which I resent. Christ is revered as the Prince of Peace, but more blood has been shed in His name than any other figure in history. You show me one step forward in the name of religion, and I'll show you a hundred retrogressions.
values.author: Frank Sinatra

values.authorQuote: Happiness lies in the joy of achievement and the thrill of creative effort.
values.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

values.authorQuote: Democracy cannot succeed unless those who express their choice are prepared to choose wisely. The real safeguard of democracy, therefore, is education.
values.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

values.authorQuote: Let us never forget that government is ourselves and not an alien power over us. The ultimate rulers of our democracy are not a President and senators and congressmen and government officials, but the voters of this country.
values.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

values.authorQuote: When you reach the end of your rope, tie a knot in it and hang on.
values.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

values.authorQuote: I'm not the smartest fellow in the world, but I can sure pick smart colleagues.
values.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

values.authorQuote: In politics, nothing happens by accident. If it happens, you can bet it was planned that way.
values.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

values.authorQuote: The point in history at which we stand is full of promise and danger. The world will either move forward toward unity and widely shared prosperity - or it will move apart.
values.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

values.authorQuote: We have always held to the hope, the belief, the conviction that there is a better life, a better world, beyond the horizon.
values.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

values.authorQuote: A nation that destroys its soils destroys itself. Forests are the lungs of our land, purifying the air and giving fresh strength to our people.
values.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

values.authorQuote: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.
values.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

values.authorQuote: Competition has been shown to be useful up to a certain point and no further, but cooperation, which is the thing we must strive for today, begins where competition leaves off.
values.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

values.authorQuote: I pledge you, I pledge myself, to a new deal for the American people.
values.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

values.authorQuote: Human kindness has never weakened the stamina or softened the fiber of a free people. A nation does not have to be cruel to be tough.
values.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

values.authorQuote: There are many ways of going forward, but only one way of standing still.
values.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

values.authorQuote: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
values.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

values.authorQuote: Confidence... thrives on honesty, on honor, on the sacredness of obligations, on faithful protection and on unselfish performance. Without them it cannot live.
values.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

values.authorQuote: Yesterday, December seventh, 1941, a date which will live in infamy, the United States of America was suddenly and deliberately attacked by naval and air forces of the Empire of Japan. We will gain the inevitable triumph, so help us God.
values.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

values.authorQuote: Nobody will ever deprive the American people of the right to vote except the American people themselves and the only way they could do this is by not voting.
values.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

values.authorQuote: Here is my principle: Taxes shall be levied according to ability to pay. That is the only American principle.
values.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

values.authorQuote: The test of our progress is not whether we add more to the abundance of those who have much it is whether we provide enough for those who have little.
values.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

values.authorQuote: Men are not prisoners of fate, but only prisoners of their own minds.
values.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

values.authorQuote: In our personal ambitions we are individualists. But in our seeking for economic and political progress as a nation, we all go up or else all go down as one people.
values.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

values.authorQuote: One thing is sure. We have to do something. We have to do the best we know how at the moment... If it doesn't turn out right, we can modify it as we go along.
values.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

values.authorQuote: True individual freedom cannot exist without economic security and independence. People who are hungry and out of a job are the stuff of which dictatorships are made.
values.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

values.authorQuote: We are trying to construct a more inclusive society. We are going to make a country in which no one is left out.
values.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

values.authorQuote: To reach a port, we must sail - sail, not tie at anchor - sail, not drift.
values.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

values.authorQuote: So long as you have food in your mouth, you have solved all questions for the time being.
values.author: Franz Kafka
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, Short story writer, Insurance officer

values.authorQuote: Start with what is right rather than what is acceptable.
values.author: Franz Kafka
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, Short story writer, Insurance officer

values.authorQuote: A book should serve as the ax for the frozen sea within us.
values.author: Franz Kafka
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, Short story writer, Insurance officer

values.authorQuote: My peers, lately, have found companionship through means of intoxication - it makes them sociable. I, however, cannot force myself to use drugs to cheat on my loneliness - it is all that I have - and when the drugs and alcohol dissipate, will be all that my peers have as well.
values.author: Franz Kafka
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, Short story writer, Insurance officer

values.authorQuote: God gives the nuts, but he does not crack them.
values.author: Franz Kafka
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, Short story writer, Insurance officer

values.authorQuote: Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old.
values.author: Franz Kafka
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, Short story writer, Insurance officer

values.authorQuote: A first sign of the beginning of understanding is the wish to die.
values.author: Franz Kafka
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, Short story writer, Insurance officer

values.authorQuote: Sensual love deceives one as to the nature of heavenly love; it could not do so alone, but since it unconsciously has the element of heavenly love within it, it can do so.
values.author: Franz Kafka
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, Short story writer, Insurance officer

values.authorQuote: Evil is whatever distracts.
values.author: Franz Kafka
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, Short story writer, Insurance officer

values.authorQuote: You do not need to leave your room. Remain sitting at your table and listen. Do not even listen, simply wait, be quiet still and solitary. The world will freely offer itself to you to be unmasked, it has no choice, it will roll in ecstasy at your feet.
values.author: Franz Kafka
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, Short story writer, Insurance officer

values.authorQuote: You can hold yourself back from the sufferings of the world, that is something you are free to do and it accords with your nature, but perhaps this very holding back is the one suffering you could avoid.
values.author: Franz Kafka
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, Short story writer, Insurance officer

values.authorQuote: The indestructible is one: it is each individual human being and, at the same time, it is common to all, hence the incomparably indivisible union that exists between human beings.
values.author: Franz Kafka
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, Short story writer, Insurance officer

values.authorQuote: If I shall exist eternally, how shall I exist tomorrow?
values.author: Franz Kafka
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, Short story writer, Insurance officer

values.authorQuote: Always first draw fresh breath after outbursts of vanity and complacency.
values.author: Franz Kafka
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, Short story writer, Insurance officer

values.authorQuote: We are sinful not only because we have eaten of the Tree of Knowledge, but also because we have not yet eaten of the Tree of Life. The state in which we are is sinful, irrespective of guilt.
values.author: Franz Kafka
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, Short story writer, Insurance officer

values.authorQuote: In argument similes are like songs in love; they describe much, but prove nothing.
values.author: Franz Kafka
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, Short story writer, Insurance officer

values.authorQuote: Every revolution evaporates and leaves behind only the slime of a new bureaucracy.
values.author: Franz Kafka
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, Short story writer, Insurance officer

values.authorQuote: Atlas was permitted the opinion that he was at liberty, if he wished, to drop the Earth and creep away; but this opinion was all that he was permitted.
values.author: Franz Kafka
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, Short story writer, Insurance officer

values.authorQuote: There are only two things. Truth and lies. Truth is indivisible, hence it cannot recognize itself; anyone who wants to recognize it has to be a lie.
values.author: Franz Kafka
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, Short story writer, Insurance officer

values.authorQuote: The experience of life consists of the experience which the spirit has of itself in matter and as matter, in mind and as mind, in emotion, as emotion, etc.
values.author: Franz Kafka
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, Short story writer, Insurance officer

values.authorQuote: A stair not worn hollow by footsteps is, regarded from its own point of view, only a boring something made of wood.
values.author: Franz Kafka
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, Short story writer, Insurance officer

values.authorQuote: In the fight between you and the world, back the world.
values.author: Franz Kafka
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, Short story writer, Insurance officer

values.authorQuote: It is often safer to be in chains than to be free.
values.author: Franz Kafka
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, Short story writer, Insurance officer

values.authorQuote: Test yourself on mankind. It is something that makes the doubter doubt, the believer believe.
values.author: Franz Kafka
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, Short story writer, Insurance officer

values.authorQuote: Productivity is being able to do things that you were never able to do before.
values.author: Franz Kafka
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, Short story writer, Insurance officer

values.authorQuote: From a certain point onward there is no longer any turning back. That is the point that must be reached.
values.author: Franz Kafka
values.authorOccupation: Novelist, Short story writer, Insurance officer

values.authorQuote: It is easier to build strong children than to repair broken men.
values.author: Frederick Douglass

values.authorQuote: If there is no struggle, there is no progress.
values.author: Frederick Douglass

values.authorQuote: Where justice is denied, where poverty is enforced, where ignorance prevails, and where any one class is made to feel that society is an organized conspiracy to oppress, rob and degrade them, neither persons nor property will be safe.
values.author: Frederick Douglass

values.authorQuote: Without a struggle, there can be no progress.
values.author: Frederick Douglass

values.authorQuote: It is not light that we need, but fire; it is not the gentle shower, but thunder. We need the storm, the whirlwind, and the earthquake.
values.author: Frederick Douglass

values.authorQuote: The thing worse than rebellion is the thing that causes rebellion.
values.author: Frederick Douglass

values.authorQuote: I prayed for twenty years but received no answer until I prayed with my legs.
values.author: Frederick Douglass

values.authorQuote: I didn't know I was a slave until I found out I couldn't do the things I wanted.
values.author: Frederick Douglass

values.authorQuote: The limits of tyrants are prescribed by the endurance of those whom they oppress.
values.author: Frederick Douglass

values.authorQuote: A battle lost or won is easily described, understood, and appreciated, but the moral growth of a great nation requires reflection, as well as observation, to appreciate it.
values.author: Frederick Douglass

values.authorQuote: The white man's happiness cannot be purchased by the black man's misery.
values.author: Frederick Douglass

values.authorQuote: The life of the nation is secure only while the nation is honest, truthful, and virtuous.
values.author: Frederick Douglass

values.authorQuote: I prefer to be true to myself, even at the hazard of incurring the ridicule of others, rather than to be false, and to incur my own abhorrence.
values.author: Frederick Douglass

values.authorQuote: No man can put a chain about the ankle of his fellow man without at last finding the other end fastened about his own neck.
values.author: Frederick Douglass

values.authorQuote: I recognize the Republican party as the sheet anchor of the colored man's political hopes and the ark of his safety.
values.author: Frederick Douglass

values.authorQuote: Those who profess to favor freedom, and yet deprecate agitation, are men who want crops without plowing up the ground.
values.author: Frederick Douglass

values.authorQuote: What to the Slave is the 4th of July.
values.author: Frederick Douglass

values.authorQuote: To suppress free speech is a double wrong. It violates the rights of the hearer as well as those of the speaker.
values.author: Frederick Douglass

values.authorQuote: At a time like this, scorching irony, not convincing argument, is needed.
values.author: Frederick Douglass

values.authorQuote: One and God make a majority.
values.author: Frederick Douglass

values.authorQuote: Find out just what any people will quietly submit to and you have the exact measure of the injustice and wrong which will be imposed on them.
values.author: Frederick Douglass

values.authorQuote: When men sow the wind it is rational to expect that they will reap the whirlwind.
values.author: Frederick Douglass

values.authorQuote: Everybody has asked the question, and they learned to ask it early of the abolitionists, 'What shall we do with the Negro?' I have had but one answer from the beginning. Do nothing with us! Your doing with us has already played the mischief with us.
values.author: Frederick Douglass

values.authorQuote: The soul that is within me no man can degrade.
values.author: Frederick Douglass

values.authorQuote: A man's character always takes its hue, more or less, from the form and color of things about him.
values.author: Frederick Douglass

values.authorQuote: Man's greatness consists in his ability to do and the proper application of his powers to things needed to be done.
values.author: Frederick Douglass

values.authorQuote: Feet, what do I need you for when I have wings to fly?
values.author: Frida Kahlo
values.authorBirthname: Magdalena Carmen Frida Kahlo y Calderón

values.authorQuote: I never paint dreams or nightmares. I paint my own reality.
values.author: Frida Kahlo
values.authorBirthname: Magdalena Carmen Frida Kahlo y Calderón

values.authorQuote: I love you more than my own skin.
values.author: Frida Kahlo
values.authorBirthname: Magdalena Carmen Frida Kahlo y Calderón

values.authorQuote: I leave you my portrait so that you will have my presence all the days and nights that I am away from you.
values.author: Frida Kahlo
values.authorBirthname: Magdalena Carmen Frida Kahlo y Calderón

values.authorQuote: I paint my own reality. The only thing I know is that I paint because I need to, and I paint whatever passes through my head without any other consideration.
values.author: Frida Kahlo
values.authorBirthname: Magdalena Carmen Frida Kahlo y Calderón

values.authorQuote: I paint flowers so they will not die.
values.author: Frida Kahlo
values.authorBirthname: Magdalena Carmen Frida Kahlo y Calderón

values.authorQuote: I am my own muse, the subject I know best.
values.author: Frida Kahlo
values.authorBirthname: Magdalena Carmen Frida Kahlo y Calderón

values.authorQuote: I paint self-portraits because I am so often alone, because I am the person I know best.
values.author: Frida Kahlo
values.authorBirthname: Magdalena Carmen Frida Kahlo y Calderón

values.authorQuote: They thought I was a Surrealist, but I wasn't. I never painted dreams. I painted my own reality.
values.author: Frida Kahlo
values.authorBirthname: Magdalena Carmen Frida Kahlo y Calderón

values.authorQuote: There have been two great accidents in my life. One was the trolley, and the other was Diego. Diego was by far the worst.
values.author: Frida Kahlo
values.authorBirthname: Magdalena Carmen Frida Kahlo y Calderón

values.authorQuote: I tried to drown my sorrows, but the bastards learned how to swim, and now I am overwhelmed by this decent and good feeling.
values.author: Frida Kahlo
values.authorBirthname: Magdalena Carmen Frida Kahlo y Calderón

values.authorQuote: The only thing I know is that I paint because I need to, and I paint whatever passes through my head without any other consideration.
values.author: Frida Kahlo
values.authorBirthname: Magdalena Carmen Frida Kahlo y Calderón

values.authorQuote: I was a child who went about in a world of colors... My friends, my companions, became women slowly; I became old in instants.
values.author: Frida Kahlo
values.authorBirthname: Magdalena Carmen Frida Kahlo y Calderón

values.authorQuote: Really, I do not know whether my paintings are surrealist or not, but I do know that they are the frankest expression of myself.
values.author: Frida Kahlo
values.authorBirthname: Magdalena Carmen Frida Kahlo y Calderón

values.authorQuote: I am in agreement with everything my father taught me and nothing my mother taught me.
values.author: Frida Kahlo
values.authorBirthname: Magdalena Carmen Frida Kahlo y Calderón

values.authorQuote: Since my subjects have always been my sensations, my states of mind and the profound reactions that life has been producing in me, I have frequently objectified all this in figures of myself, which were the most sincere and real thing that I could do in order to express what I felt inside and outside of myself.
values.author: Frida Kahlo
values.authorBirthname: Magdalena Carmen Frida Kahlo y Calderón

values.authorQuote: The most important part of the body is the brain. Of my face, I like the eyebrows and eyes. Aside from that, I like nothing. My head is too small.
values.author: Frida Kahlo
values.authorBirthname: Magdalena Carmen Frida Kahlo y Calderón

values.authorQuote: To paint is the most terrific thing that there is, but to do it well is very difficult.
values.author: Frida Kahlo
values.authorBirthname: Magdalena Carmen Frida Kahlo y Calderón

values.authorQuote: Of the opposite sex, I have the moustache and, in general, the face.
values.author: Frida Kahlo
values.authorBirthname: Magdalena Carmen Frida Kahlo y Calderón

values.authorQuote: I am happy to be alive, as long as I can paint.
values.author: Frida Kahlo
values.authorBirthname: Magdalena Carmen Frida Kahlo y Calderón

values.authorQuote: My painting carries with it the message of pain.
values.author: Frida Kahlo
values.authorBirthname: Magdalena Carmen Frida Kahlo y Calderón

values.authorQuote: Painting completed my life.
values.author: Frida Kahlo
values.authorBirthname: Magdalena Carmen Frida Kahlo y Calderón

values.authorQuote: I don't know how to write love letters.
values.author: Frida Kahlo
values.authorBirthname: Magdalena Carmen Frida Kahlo y Calderón

values.authorQuote: I put on the canvas whatever comes into my mind.
values.author: Frida Kahlo
values.authorBirthname: Magdalena Carmen Frida Kahlo y Calderón

values.authorQuote: I find that Americans completely lack sensibility and good taste. They are boring, and they all have faces like unbaked rolls.
values.author: Frida Kahlo
values.authorBirthname: Magdalena Carmen Frida Kahlo y Calderón

values.authorQuote: My toys were those of a boy: skates, bicycles.
values.author: Frida Kahlo
values.authorBirthname: Magdalena Carmen Frida Kahlo y Calderón

values.authorQuote: It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages.
values.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
