values.authorQuote: Without music, life would be a mistake.
values.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, cultural critic, composer, poet, philologist

values.authorQuote: To live is to suffer, to survive is to find some meaning in the suffering.
values.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, cultural critic, composer, poet, philologist

values.authorQuote: Whoever fights monsters should see to it that in the process he does not become a monster. And if you gaze long enough into an abyss, the abyss will gaze back into you.
values.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, cultural critic, composer, poet, philologist

values.authorQuote: There is always some madness in love. But there is also always some reason in madness.
values.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, cultural critic, composer, poet, philologist

values.authorQuote: Thoughts are the shadows of our feelings - always darker, emptier and simpler.
values.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, cultural critic, composer, poet, philologist

values.authorQuote: On the mountains of truth you can never climb in vain: either you will reach a point higher up today, or you will be training your powers so that you will be able to climb higher tomorrow.
values.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, cultural critic, composer, poet, philologist

values.authorQuote: All truly great thoughts are conceived by walking.
values.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, cultural critic, composer, poet, philologist

values.authorQuote: It is always consoling to think of suicide: in that way one gets through many a bad night.
values.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, cultural critic, composer, poet, philologist

values.authorQuote: God is dead. God remains dead. And we have killed him. Yet his shadow still looms. How shall we comfort ourselves, the murderers of all murderers? What was holiest and mightiest of all that the world has yet owned has bled to death under our knives; who will wipe this blood off us? What water is there for us to clean ourselves?
values.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, cultural critic, composer, poet, philologist

values.authorQuote: The doer alone learneth.
values.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, cultural critic, composer, poet, philologist

values.authorQuote: The man of knowledge must be able not only to love his enemies but also to hate his friends.
values.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, cultural critic, composer, poet, philologist

values.authorQuote: We love life, not because we are used to living but because we are used to loving.
values.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, cultural critic, composer, poet, philologist

values.authorQuote: The individual has always had to struggle to keep from being overwhelmed by the tribe. If you try it, you will be lonely often, and sometimes frightened. But no price is too high to pay for the privilege of owning yourself.
values.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, cultural critic, composer, poet, philologist

values.authorQuote: One must still have chaos in oneself to be able to give birth to a dancing star.
values.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, cultural critic, composer, poet, philologist

values.authorQuote: That which does not kill us makes us stronger.
values.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, cultural critic, composer, poet, philologist

values.authorQuote: In every real man a child is hidden that wants to play.
values.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, cultural critic, composer, poet, philologist

values.authorQuote: When marrying, ask yourself this question: Do you believe that you will be able to converse well with this person into your old age? Everything else in marriage is transitory.
values.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, cultural critic, composer, poet, philologist

values.authorQuote: In individuals, insanity is rare; but in groups, parties, nations and epochs, it is the rule.
values.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, cultural critic, composer, poet, philologist

values.authorQuote: Many are stubborn in pursuit of the path they have chosen, few in pursuit of the goal.
values.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, cultural critic, composer, poet, philologist

values.authorQuote: The surest way to corrupt a youth is to instruct him to hold in higher esteem those who think alike than those who think differently.
values.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, cultural critic, composer, poet, philologist

values.authorQuote: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
values.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, cultural critic, composer, poet, philologist

values.authorQuote: There are no facts, only interpretations.
values.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, cultural critic, composer, poet, philologist

values.authorQuote: There are horrible people who, instead of solving a problem, tangle it up and make it harder to solve for anyone who wants to deal with it. Whoever does not know how to hit the nail on the head should be asked not to hit it at all.
values.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, cultural critic, composer, poet, philologist

values.authorQuote: The future influences the present just as much as the past.
values.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, cultural critic, composer, poet, philologist

values.authorQuote: A casual stroll through the lunatic asylum shows that faith does not prove anything.
values.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
values.authorOccupation: Philosopher, cultural critic, composer, poet, philologist

values.authorQuote: We sometimes encounter people, even perfect strangers, who begin to interest us at first sight, somehow suddenly, all at once, before a word has been spoken.
values.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

values.authorQuote: Much unhappiness has come into the world because of bewilderment and things left unsaid.
values.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

values.authorQuote: A real gentleman, even if he loses everything he owns, must show no emotion. Money must be so far beneath a gentleman that it is hardly worth troubling about.
values.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

values.authorQuote: The cleverest of all, in my opinion, is the man who calls himself a fool at least once a month.
values.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

values.authorQuote: Man is fond of counting his troubles, but he does not count his joys. If he counted them up as he ought to, he would see that every lot has enough happiness provided for it.
values.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

values.authorQuote: One can know a man from his laugh, and if you like a man's laugh before you know anything of him, you may confidently say that he is a good man.
values.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

values.authorQuote: If there is no God, everything is permitted.
values.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

values.authorQuote: The soul is healed by being with children.
values.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

values.authorQuote: Sarcasm: the last refuge of modest and chaste-souled people when the privacy of their soul is coarsely and intrusively invaded.
values.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

values.authorQuote: Deprived of meaningful work, men and women lose their reason for existence; they go stark, raving mad.
values.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

values.authorQuote: Beauty is mysterious as well as terrible. God and devil are fighting there, and the battlefield is the heart of man.
values.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

values.authorQuote: The greatest happiness is to know the source of unhappiness.
values.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

values.authorQuote: To live without Hope is to Cease to live.
values.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

values.authorQuote: There are things which a man is afraid to tell even to himself, and every decent man has a number of such things stored away in his mind.
values.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

values.authorQuote: To love someone means to see him as God intended him.
values.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

values.authorQuote: Men do not accept their prophets and slay them, but they love their martyrs and worship those whom they have tortured to death.
values.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

values.authorQuote: It seems, in fact, as though the second half of a man's life is made up of nothing, but the habits he has accumulated during the first half.
values.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

values.authorQuote: Happiness does not lie in happiness, but in the achievement of it.
values.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

values.authorQuote: It is not possible to eat me without insisting that I sing praises of my devourer?
values.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

values.authorQuote: If you were to destroy the belief in immortality in mankind, not only love but every living force on which the continuation of all life in the world depended, would dry up at once.
values.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

values.authorQuote: The formula 'Two and two make five' is not without its attractions.
values.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

values.authorQuote: Power is given only to those who dare to lower themselves and pick it up. Only one thing matters, one thing; to be able to dare!
values.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

values.authorQuote: A novel is a work of poetry. In order to write it, one must have tranquility of spirit and of impression.
values.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

values.authorQuote: There is no subject so old that something new cannot be said about it.
values.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

values.authorQuote: Realists do not fear the results of their study.
values.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

values.authorQuote: Man, so long as he remains free, has no more constant and agonizing anxiety than find as quickly as possible someone to worship.
values.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

values.authorQuote: All truths are easy to understand once they are discovered; the point is to discover them.

values.authorQuote: We cannot teach people anything; we can only help them discover it within themselves.

values.authorQuote: I have never met a man so ignorant that I couldn't learn something from him.

values.authorQuote: Where the senses fail us, reason must step in.

values.authorQuote: By denying scientific principles, one may maintain any paradox.

values.authorQuote: The Bible shows the way to go to heaven, not the way the heavens go.

values.authorOccupation: Polymath, central figure in the transition from natural philosophy to modern science

values.authorQuote: Philosophy is written in this grand book, the universe, which stands continually open to our gaze. But the book cannot be understood unless one first learns to comprehend the language and read the letters in which it is composed.

values.authorQuote: Measure what is measurable, and make measurable what is not so.
values.author: Galileo Galilei
values.authorOccupation: Polymath, central figure in the transition from natural philosophy to modern science

values.authorQuote: I do not feel obliged to believe that the same God who has endowed us with sense, reason, and intellect has intended us to forgo their use.

values.authorQuote: And yet it moves.
values.author: Galileo Galilei
values.authorOccupation: Polymath, central figure in the transition from natural philosophy to modern science

values.authorQuote: The Milky Way is nothing else but a mass of innumerable stars planted together in clusters.
values.author: Galileo Galilei
values.authorOccupation: Polymath, central figure in the transition from natural philosophy to modern science

values.authorQuote: Facts which at first seem improbable will, even on scant explanation, drop the cloak which has hidden them and stand forth in naked and simple beauty.
values.author: Galileo Galilei
values.authorOccupation: Polymath, central figure in the transition from natural philosophy to modern science

values.authorQuote: The sun, with all those planets revolving around it and dependent on it, can still ripen a bunch of grapes as if it had nothing else in the universe to do.
values.author: Galileo Galilei
values.authorOccupation: Polymath, central figure in the transition from natural philosophy to modern science

values.authorQuote: I think that in the discussion of natural problems we ought to begin not with the Scriptures, but with experiments, and demonstrations.
values.author: Galileo Galilei
values.authorOccupation: Polymath, central figure in the transition from natural philosophy to modern science

values.authorQuote: We must say that there are as many squares as there are numbers.
values.author: Galileo Galilei
values.authorOccupation: Polymath, central figure in the transition from natural philosophy to modern science

values.authorQuote: It vexes me when they would constrain science by the authority of the Scriptures, and yet do not consider themselves bound to answer reason and experiment.
values.author: Galileo Galilei
values.authorOccupation: Polymath, central figure in the transition from natural philosophy to modern science

values.authorQuote: In questions of science, the authority of a thousand is not worth the humble reasoning of a single individual.
values.author: Galileo Galilei
values.authorOccupation: Polymath, central figure in the transition from natural philosophy to modern science

values.authorQuote: If I were again beginning my studies, I would follow the advice of Plato and start with mathematics.
values.author: Galileo Galilei
values.authorOccupation: Polymath, central figure in the transition from natural philosophy to modern science

values.authorQuote: I give infinite thanks to God, who has been pleased to make me the first observer of marvelous things.
values.author: Galileo Galilei
values.authorOccupation: Polymath, central figure in the transition from natural philosophy to modern science

values.authorQuote: It is surely harmful to souls to make it a heresy to believe what is proved.
values.author: Galileo Galilei
values.authorOccupation: Polymath, central figure in the transition from natural philosophy to modern science

values.authorQuote: I notice that young men go to the universities in order to become doctors or philosophers or anything, so long as it is a title, and that many go in for those professions who are utterly unfit for them, while others who would be very competent are prevented by business or their daily cares, which keep them away from letters.
values.author: Galileo Galilei
values.authorOccupation: Polymath, central figure in the transition from natural philosophy to modern science

values.authorQuote: Nature is relentless and unchangeable, and it is indifferent as to whether its hidden reasons and actions are understandable to man or not.
values.author: Galileo Galilei
values.authorOccupation: Polymath, central figure in the transition from natural philosophy to modern science

values.authorQuote: The nature of the human mind is such that unless it is stimulated by images of things acting upon it from without, all remembrance of them passes easily away.
values.author: Galileo Galilei
values.authorOccupation: Polymath, central figure in the transition from natural philosophy to modern science

values.authorQuote: Who would set a limit to the mind of man? Who would dare assert that we know all there is to be known?
values.author: Galileo Galilei
values.authorOccupation: Polymath, central figure in the transition from natural philosophy to modern science

values.authorQuote: He who looks the higher is the more highly distinguished, and turning over the great book of nature (which is the proper object of philosophy) is the way to elevate one's gaze.
values.author: Galileo Galilei
values.authorOccupation: Polymath, central figure in the transition from natural philosophy to modern science

values.authorQuote: I attract a crowd, not because I'm an extrovert or I'm over the top or I'm oozing with charisma. It's because I care.
values.author: Gary Vaynerchuk

values.authorQuote: You have to understand your own personal DNA. Don't do things because I do them or Steve Jobs or Mark Cuban tried it. You need to know your personal brand and stay true to it.
values.author: Gary Vaynerchuk

values.authorQuote: If I could drink only one wine, it would be Champagne.
values.author: Gary Vaynerchuk

values.authorQuote: When I hear people debate the ROI of social media? It makes me remember why so many business fail. Most businesses are not playing the marathon. They're playing the sprint. They're not worried about lifetime value and retention. They're worried about short-term goals.
values.author: Gary Vaynerchuk

values.authorQuote: People are chasing cash, not happiness. When you chase money, you're going to lose. You're just going to. Even if you get the money, you're not going to be happy.
values.author: Gary Vaynerchuk

values.authorQuote: I hate recording all the shows for the week in one day, because I want to be able to mention current events and pop culture. If Madonna punches Britney in the face today, I want to reference that on 'Wine Library TV' tomorrow. Monday's episode is always the best, because it's hot off the press.
values.author: Gary Vaynerchuk

values.authorQuote: Social media requires that business leaders start thinking like small-town shop owners. This means taking the long view and avoiding short-term benchmarks to gauge progress. It means allowing the personality, heart and soul of the people who run all levels of the business to show.
values.author: Gary Vaynerchuk

values.authorQuote: The reason we love our parents is because they loved us first. Every single company should take this advice.
values.author: Gary Vaynerchuk

values.authorQuote: I don't want anybody to not recognize how appreciative I am of the volume of e-mails I get.
values.author: Gary Vaynerchuk

values.authorQuote: The chef that grew up with the grandma who cooks tends to always beat the chef that went to the culinary institute. It's in the blood.
values.author: Gary Vaynerchuk

values.authorQuote: I want people to know their palate is a snowflake. We all like different things. Why should we all have the same taste in wines?
values.author: Gary Vaynerchuk

values.authorQuote: Stop doing things that waste time. Don't replace time with your family or things that you need to do. I needed to put together two fantasy teams this weekend because that's something I enjoy, but I did stop playing Nintendo Wii for hours on end.
values.author: Gary Vaynerchuk

values.authorQuote: Nobody walks this earth thinking he's better than I think I am - I think I'm great. At the same time, it's so obvious to me that I'm nobody.
values.author: Gary Vaynerchuk

values.authorQuote: You cannot underestimate people's ability to spot a soulless, bureaucratic tactic a million miles away. It's a big reason why so many companies that have dipped a toe in social media waters have failed miserably.
values.author: Gary Vaynerchuk

values.authorQuote: Storytelling is the game. It's what we all do. It's why Nike is Nike, it's why Apple is Apple, it's why Walt Disney built Disney World and it's why Vince McMahon makes a billion dollars.
values.author: Gary Vaynerchuk

values.authorQuote: From age 16, I lived and breathed wine. I read every magazine and book about wine.
values.author: Gary Vaynerchuk

values.authorQuote: I have no interest in going to Egypt and seeing the pyramids. I'm just not that kind of dude.
values.author: Gary Vaynerchuk

values.authorQuote: If there's a problem, we at Wine Library never tell ourselves that once we handle this issue, we'll never have to deal with the person again. We talk to every single person as though we're going to wind up sitting next to that person at his or her mother's house that night for dinner.
values.author: Gary Vaynerchuk

values.authorQuote: I would argue heavily that the time that has been allocated to social used to come from television, and people are benefitting from it. People who are saying, 'Aw, you're spending all your time on Facebook, or all your time on Twitter,' I'd like to understand what the person used to do with that time.
values.author: Gary Vaynerchuk

values.authorQuote: Brands mature over time, like a marriage. The bond you feel with your spouse is different than when you first met each other. Excitement and discovery are replaced by comfort and depth.
values.author: Gary Vaynerchuk

values.authorQuote: I love people, and the hustle.
values.author: Gary Vaynerchuk

values.authorQuote: When the tech geeks talk, I pay close attention.
values.author: Gary Vaynerchuk

values.authorQuote: It's insane to me to ask anybody to be what they're not. Know what you know the best, love the most. That's always going to be the answer to the thing that you have the best shot at winning at.
values.author: Gary Vaynerchuk

values.authorQuote: I think what's happening for me, it's fun to see other things besides Facebook and Twitter take hold. The maturity of Tumblr as a real player is exciting. I think Pinterest has proved to be a major player. It's fun to see Instagram become a major player. It's fun to watch things like SnapChat, and Vine, try to vie to be the next thing.
values.author: Gary Vaynerchuk

values.authorQuote: A broad trend I'm completely obsessed with is mobile commerce. Like completely. I'm completely convinced that everybody's going to be buying from their mobile devices. Whoever can claim that space or be in that space, I'm very interested in.
values.author: Gary Vaynerchuk

values.authorQuote: The reason I was able to grow my business was that every day, after producing 30 minutes of wine television, I spent 15 hours a day replying to every single person's e-mail and every single person's Twitter @ reply.
values.author: Gary Vaynerchuk

values.authorQuote: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
values.author: George Bernard Shaw

values.authorQuote: Progress is impossible without change, and those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything.
values.author: George Bernard Shaw

values.authorQuote: We are made wise not by the recollection of our past, but by the responsibility for our future.
values.author: George Bernard Shaw

values.authorQuote: There is no sincerer love than the love of food.
values.author: George Bernard Shaw

values.authorQuote: The single biggest problem in communication is the illusion that it has taken place.
values.author: George Bernard Shaw

values.authorQuote: Success does not consist in never making mistakes but in never making the same one a second time.
values.author: George Bernard Shaw

values.authorQuote: Beware of false knowledge; it is more dangerous than ignorance.
values.author: George Bernard Shaw

values.authorQuote: Imagination is the beginning of creation. You imagine what you desire, you will what you imagine and at last you create what you will.
values.author: George Bernard Shaw

values.authorQuote: I learned long ago, never to wrestle with a pig. You get dirty, and besides, the pig likes it.
values.author: George Bernard Shaw

values.authorQuote: Take care to get what you like or you will be forced to like what you get.
values.author: George Bernard Shaw

values.authorQuote: A happy family is but an earlier heaven.
values.author: George Bernard Shaw

values.authorQuote: Marriage is an alliance entered into by a man who can't sleep with the window shut, and a woman who can't sleep with the window open.
values.author: George Bernard Shaw

values.authorQuote: If you cannot get rid of the family skeleton, you may as well make it dance.
values.author: George Bernard Shaw

values.authorQuote: A gentleman is one who puts more into the world than he takes out.
values.author: George Bernard Shaw

values.authorQuote: Better keep yourself clean and bright; you are the window through which you must see the world.
values.author: George Bernard Shaw

values.authorQuote: A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable, but more useful than a life spent doing nothing.
values.author: George Bernard Shaw

values.authorQuote: If history repeats itself, and the unexpected always happens, how incapable must Man be of learning from experience.
values.author: George Bernard Shaw

values.authorQuote: It is the mark of a truly intelligent person to be moved by statistics.
values.author: George Bernard Shaw

values.authorQuote: The great advantage of a hotel is that it is a refuge from home life.
values.author: George Bernard Shaw

values.authorQuote: First love is only a little foolishness and a lot of curiosity.
values.author: George Bernard Shaw

values.authorQuote: A fool's brain digests philosophy into folly, science into superstition, and art into pedantry. Hence University education.
values.author: George Bernard Shaw

values.authorQuote: The golden rule is that there are no golden rules.
values.author: George Bernard Shaw

values.authorQuote: You see things; and you say 'Why?' But I dream things that never were; and I say 'Why not?'
values.author: George Bernard Shaw

values.authorQuote: No question is so difficult to answer as that to which the answer is obvious.
values.author: George Bernard Shaw

values.authorQuote: Do not do unto others as you expect they should do unto you. Their tastes may not be the same.
values.author: George Bernard Shaw

values.authorQuote: No man who is occupied in doing a very difficult thing, and doing it very well, ever loses his self-respect.
values.author: George Bernard Shaw

values.authorQuote: Weather forecast for tonight: dark.
values.author: George Carlin
values.authorOccupation: Stand-up comedian, actor, author, social critic

values.authorQuote: May the forces of evil become confused on the way to your house.
values.author: George Carlin
values.authorOccupation: Stand-up comedian, actor, author, social critic

values.authorQuote: There are nights when the wolves are silent and only the moon howls.
values.author: George Carlin
values.authorOccupation: Stand-up comedian, actor, author, social critic

values.authorQuote: Just cause you got the monkey off your back doesn't mean the circus has left town.
values.author: George Carlin
values.authorOccupation: Stand-up comedian, actor, author, social critic

values.authorQuote: Frisbeetarianism is the belief that when you die, your soul goes up on the roof and gets stuck.
values.author: George Carlin
values.authorOccupation: Stand-up comedian, actor, author, social critic

values.authorQuote: Don't sweat the petty things and don't pet the sweaty things.
values.author: George Carlin
values.authorOccupation: Stand-up comedian, actor, author, social critic

values.authorQuote: Electricity is really just organized lightning.
values.author: George Carlin
values.authorOccupation: Stand-up comedian, actor, author, social critic

values.authorQuote: One tequila, two tequila, three tequila, floor.
values.author: George Carlin
values.authorOccupation: Stand-up comedian, actor, author, social critic

values.authorQuote: Some people see things that are and ask, Why? Some people dream of things that never were and ask, Why not? Some people have to go to work and don't have time for all that.
values.author: George Carlin
values.authorOccupation: Stand-up comedian, actor, author, social critic

values.authorQuote: Inside every cynical person, there is a disappointed idealist.
values.author: George Carlin
values.authorOccupation: Stand-up comedian, actor, author, social critic

values.authorQuote: I went to a bookstore and asked the saleswoman, 'Where's the self-help section?' She said if she told me, it would defeat the purpose.
values.author: George Carlin
values.authorOccupation: Stand-up comedian, actor, author, social critic

values.authorQuote: When you're born you get a ticket to the freak show. When you're born in America, you get a front row seat.
values.author: George Carlin
values.authorOccupation: Stand-up comedian, actor, author, social critic

values.authorQuote: Have you ever noticed that anybody driving slower than you is an idiot, and anyone going faster than you is a maniac?
values.author: George Carlin
values.authorOccupation: Stand-up comedian, actor, author, social critic

values.authorQuote: I recently went to a new doctor and noticed he was located in something called the Professional Building. I felt better right away.
values.author: George Carlin
values.authorOccupation: Stand-up comedian, actor, author, social critic

values.authorQuote: When you step on the brakes your life is in your foot's hands.
values.author: George Carlin
values.authorOccupation: Stand-up comedian, actor, author, social critic

values.authorQuote: Well, if crime fighters fight crime and fire fighters fight fire, what do freedom fighters fight? They never mention that part to us, do they?
values.author: George Carlin
values.authorOccupation: Stand-up comedian, actor, author, social critic

values.authorQuote: I have as much authority as the Pope, I just don't have as many people who believe it.
values.author: George Carlin
values.authorOccupation: Stand-up comedian, actor, author, social critic

values.authorQuote: 'I am' is reportedly the shortest sentence in the English language. Could it be that 'I do' is the longest sentence?
values.author: George Carlin
values.authorOccupation: Stand-up comedian, actor, author, social critic

values.authorQuote: I was thinking about how people seem to read the Bible a whole lot more as they get older; then it dawned on me - they're cramming for their final exam.
values.author: George Carlin
values.authorOccupation: Stand-up comedian, actor, author, social critic

values.authorQuote: Atheism is a non-prophet organization.
values.author: George Carlin
values.authorOccupation: Stand-up comedian, actor, author, social critic

values.authorQuote: People who say they don't care what people think are usually desperate to have people think they don't care what people think.
values.author: George Carlin
values.authorOccupation: Stand-up comedian, actor, author, social critic

values.authorQuote: If you can't beat them, arrange to have them beaten.
values.author: George Carlin
values.authorOccupation: Stand-up comedian, actor, author, social critic

values.authorQuote: You know an odd feeling? Sitting on the toilet eating a chocolate candy bar.
values.author: George Carlin
values.authorOccupation: Stand-up comedian, actor, author, social critic

values.authorQuote: The main reason Santa is so jolly is because he knows where all the bad girls live.
values.author: George Carlin
values.authorOccupation: Stand-up comedian, actor, author, social critic

values.authorQuote: The reason I talk to myself is that I'm the only one whose answers I accept.
values.author: George Carlin
values.authorOccupation: Stand-up comedian, actor, author, social critic

values.authorQuote: By and large, language is a tool for concealing the truth.
values.author: George Carlin
values.authorOccupation: Stand-up comedian, actor, author, social critic

values.authorQuote: You simply have to put one foot in front of the other and keep going. Put blinders on and plow right ahead.
values.author: George Lucas

values.authorQuote: You can't do it unless you can imagine it.
values.author: George Lucas

values.authorQuote: I wanted to race cars. I didn't like school, and all I wanted to do was work on cars. But right before I graduated, I got into a really bad car accident, and I spent that summer in the hospital thinking about where I was heading. I decided to take education more seriously and go to a community college.
values.author: George Lucas

values.authorQuote: If the boy and girl walk off into the sunset hand-in-hand in the last scene, it adds 10 million to the box office.
values.author: George Lucas

values.authorQuote: Working hard is very important. You're not going to get anywhere without working extremely hard.
values.author: George Lucas

values.authorQuote: The story being told in 'Star Wars' is a classic one. Every few hundred years, the story is retold because we have a tendency to do the same things over and over again. Power corrupts, and when you're in charge, you start doing things that you think are right, but they're actually not.
values.author: George Lucas

values.authorQuote: When I was making 'Star Wars,' I wasn't restrained by any kind of science. I simply said, 'I'm going to create a world that's fun and interesting, makes sense, and seems to have a reality to it.'
values.author: George Lucas

values.authorQuote: The secret is not to give up hope. It's very hard not to because if you're really doing something worthwhile I think you will be pushed to the brink of hopelessness before you come through the other side.
values.author: George Lucas

values.authorQuote: Whatever has happened in my quest for innovation has been part of my quest for immaculate reality.
values.author: George Lucas

values.authorQuote: A director makes 100 decisions an hour. Students ask me how you know how to make the right decision, and I say to them, 'If you don't know how to make the right decision, you're not a director.'
values.author: George Lucas

values.authorQuote: The influence of 'Hidden Fortress' comes up a lot because it was printed in a book once. The truth is, the only thing I was inspired by was the fact that it's told from the point of view of two peasants, who get mixed up with a samurai and princess and a lot of very high-level people.
values.author: George Lucas

values.authorQuote: One thing about 'Star Wars' that I'm really proud of is that it expands the imagination. That's why I like the 'Star Wars' toys.
values.author: George Lucas

values.authorQuote: 'Star Wars' is fun, its exciting, its inspirational, and people respond to that. It's what they want.
values.author: George Lucas

values.authorQuote: The technology keeps moving forward, which makes it easier for the artists to tell their stories and paint the pictures they want.
values.author: George Lucas

values.authorQuote: Everybody has talent, it's just a matter of moving around until you've discovered what it is.
values.author: George Lucas

values.authorQuote: Before I became a film major, I was very heavily into social science, I had done a lot of sociology, anthropology, and I was playing in what I call social psychology, which is sort of an offshoot of anthropology/sociology - looking at a culture as a living organism, why it does what it does.
values.author: George Lucas

values.authorQuote: I loved photography and everybody said it was a crazy thing to do because in those days nobody made it into the film business. I mean, unless you were related to somebody there was no way in.
values.author: George Lucas

values.authorQuote: Good luck has its storms.
values.author: George Lucas

values.authorQuote: I'm not much of a math and science guy. I spent most of my time in school daydreaming and managed to turn it into a living.
values.author: George Lucas

values.authorQuote: A lot of people like to do certain things, but they're not that good at it. Keep going through the things that you like to do, until you find something that you actually seem to be extremely good at. It can be anything.
values.author: George Lucas

values.authorQuote: The secret to film is that it's an illusion.
values.author: George Lucas

values.authorQuote: A film is sort of binary - it either works or it doesn't work. It has nothing to do with how good a job you do. If you bring it up to an adequate level where the audience goes with the movie, then it works, that is all.
values.author: George Lucas

values.authorQuote: I live a reasonably simple life, off the beaten track.
values.author: George Lucas

values.authorQuote: I realized why directors are such horrible people - in a way - because you want things to be right, and people will just not listen to you, and there is no time to be nice to people, no time to be delicate.
values.author: George Lucas

values.authorQuote: Football games are on TV, and it doesn't affect stadium attendance at all. It's the same with movies. People who really love movies and like to go out on a Saturday night will go to the movie theater.
values.author: George Lucas

values.authorQuote: None of the films I've done was designed for a mass audience, except for 'Indiana Jones.' Nobody in their right mind thought 'American Graffiti' or 'Star Wars' would work.
values.author: George Lucas

values.authorQuote: War is peace. Freedom is slavery. Ignorance is strength.
values.author: George Orwell

values.authorQuote: Political language... is designed to make lies sound truthful and murder respectable, and to give an appearance of solidity to pure wind.
values.author: George Orwell

values.authorQuote: The very concept of objective truth is fading out of the world. Lies will pass into history.
values.author: George Orwell

values.authorQuote: People sleep peaceably in their beds at night only because rough men stand ready to do violence on their behalf.
values.author: George Orwell

values.authorQuote: Happiness can exist only in acceptance.
values.author: George Orwell

values.authorQuote: Who controls the past controls the future. Who controls the present controls the past.
values.author: George Orwell

values.authorQuote: Each generation imagines itself to be more intelligent than the one that went before it, and wiser than the one that comes after it.
values.author: George Orwell

values.authorQuote: In our age there is no such thing as 'keeping out of politics.' All issues are political issues, and politics itself is a mass of lies, evasions, folly, hatred and schizophrenia.
values.author: George Orwell

values.authorQuote: Freedom is the right to tell people what they do not want to hear.
values.author: George Orwell

values.authorQuote: If liberty means anything at all, it means the right to tell people what they do not want to hear.
values.author: George Orwell

values.authorQuote: Power is not a means, it is an end. One does not establish a dictatorship in order to safeguard a revolution; one makes the revolution in order to establish the dictatorship.
values.author: George Orwell

values.authorQuote: The essence of being human is that one does not seek perfection.
values.author: George Orwell

values.authorQuote: The great enemy of clear language is insincerity. When there is a gap between one's real and one's declared aims, one turns, as it were, instinctively to long words and exhausted idioms, like a cuttlefish squirting out ink.
values.author: George Orwell

values.authorQuote: All animals are equal, but some animals are more equal than others.
values.author: George Orwell

values.authorQuote: So much of left-wing thought is a kind of playing with fire by people who don't even know that fire is hot.
values.author: George Orwell

values.authorQuote: Serious sport has nothing to do with fair play. It is bound up with hatred, jealousy, boastfulness, disregard of all rules and sadistic pleasure in witnessing violence. In other words, it is war minus the shooting.
values.author: George Orwell

values.authorQuote: It is also true that one can write nothing readable unless one constantly struggles to efface one's own personality. Good prose is like a windowpane.
values.author: George Orwell

values.authorQuote: What can you do against the lunatic who is more intelligent than yourself, who gives your arguments a fair hearing and then simply persists in his lunacy?
values.author: George Orwell

values.authorQuote: Society has always to demand a little more from human beings than it will get in practice.
values.author: George Orwell

values.authorQuote: Liberal: a power worshipper without power.
values.author: George Orwell

values.authorQuote: We of the sinking middle class may sink without further struggles into the working class where we belong, and probably when we get there it will not be so dreadful as we feared, for, after all, we have nothing to lose.
values.author: George Orwell

values.authorQuote: If you want a vision of the future, imagine a boot stamping on a human face - forever.
values.author: George Orwell

values.authorQuote: As with the Christian religion, the worst advertisement for Socialism is its adherents.
values.author: George Orwell

values.authorQuote: For a creative writer possession of the 'truth' is less important than emotional sincerity.
values.author: George Orwell

values.authorQuote: All political thinking for years past has been vitiated in the same way. People can foresee the future only when it coincides with their own wishes, and the most grossly obvious facts can be ignored when they are unwelcome.
values.author: George Orwell

values.authorQuote: The nationalist not only does not disapprove of atrocities committed by his own side, but he has a remarkable capacity for not even hearing about them.
values.author: George Orwell

values.authorQuote: It is foolish and wrong to mourn the men who died. Rather we should thank God that such men lived.
values.author: George S. Patton
values.authorOccupation: Senior officer of the United States Army

values.authorQuote: Accept the challenges so that you can feel the exhilaration of victory.
values.author: George S. Patton
values.authorOccupation: Senior officer of the United States Army

values.authorQuote: The object of war is not to die for your country but to make the other bastard die for his.
values.author: George S. Patton
values.authorOccupation: Senior officer of the United States Army

values.authorQuote: Battle is the most magnificent competition in which a human being can indulge. It brings out all that is best; it removes all that is base. All men are afraid in battle. The coward is the one who lets his fear overcome his sense of duty. Duty is the essence of manhood.
values.author: George S. Patton
values.authorOccupation: Senior officer of the United States Army

values.authorQuote: A good plan violently executed now is better than a perfect plan executed next week.
values.author: George S. Patton
values.authorOccupation: Senior officer of the United States Army

values.authorQuote: Success is how high you bounce when you hit bottom.
values.author: George S. Patton
values.authorOccupation: Senior officer of the United States Army

values.authorQuote: Wars may be fought with weapons, but they are won by men. It is the spirit of men who follow and of the man who leads that gains the victory.
values.author: George S. Patton
values.authorOccupation: Senior officer of the United States Army

values.authorQuote: If everyone is thinking alike, then somebody isn't thinking.
values.author: George S. Patton
values.authorOccupation: Senior officer of the United States Army

values.authorQuote: Courage is fear holding on a minute longer.
values.author: George S. Patton
values.authorOccupation: Senior officer of the United States Army

values.authorQuote: If you tell people where to go, but not how to get there, you'll be amazed at the results.
values.author: George S. Patton
values.authorOccupation: Senior officer of the United States Army

values.authorQuote: Don't tell people how to do things, tell them what to do and let them surprise you with their results.
values.author: George S. Patton
values.authorOccupation: Senior officer of the United States Army

values.authorQuote: You need to overcome the tug of people against you as you reach for high goals.
values.author: George S. Patton
values.authorOccupation: Senior officer of the United States Army

values.authorQuote: We herd sheep, we drive cattle, we lead people. Lead me, follow me, or get out of my way.
values.author: George S. Patton
values.authorOccupation: Senior officer of the United States Army

values.authorQuote: Better to fight for something than live for nothing.
values.author: George S. Patton
values.authorOccupation: Senior officer of the United States Army

values.authorQuote: A pint of sweat, saves a gallon of blood.
values.author: George S. Patton
values.authorOccupation: Senior officer of the United States Army

values.authorQuote: Always do everything you ask of those you command.
values.author: George S. Patton
values.authorOccupation: Senior officer of the United States Army

values.authorQuote: Prepare for the unknown by studying how others in the past have coped with the unforeseeable and the unpredictable.
values.author: George S. Patton
values.authorOccupation: Senior officer of the United States Army

values.authorQuote: Nobody ever defended anything successfully, there is only attack and attack and attack some more.
values.author: George S. Patton
values.authorOccupation: Senior officer of the United States Army

values.authorQuote: There is only one sort of discipline, perfect discipline.
values.author: George S. Patton
values.authorOccupation: Senior officer of the United States Army

values.authorQuote: Take calculated risks. That is quite different from being rash.
values.author: George S. Patton
values.authorOccupation: Senior officer of the United States Army

values.authorQuote: If we take the generally accepted definition of bravery as a quality which knows no fear, I have never seen a brave man. All men are frightened. The more intelligent they are, the more they are frightened.
values.author: George S. Patton
values.authorOccupation: Senior officer of the United States Army

values.authorQuote: If a man does his best, what else is there?
values.author: George S. Patton
values.authorOccupation: Senior officer of the United States Army

values.authorQuote: Americans love to fight. All real Americans love the sting of battle.
values.author: George S. Patton
values.authorOccupation: Senior officer of the United States Army

values.authorQuote: Never tell people how to do things. Tell them what to do and they will surprise you with their ingenuity.
values.author: George S. Patton
values.authorOccupation: Senior officer of the United States Army

values.authorQuote: Americans play to win at all times. I wouldn't give a hoot and hell for a man who lost and laughed. That's why Americans have never lost nor ever lose a war.
values.author: George S. Patton
values.authorOccupation: Senior officer of the United States Army

values.authorQuote: A piece of spaghetti or a military unit can only be led from the front end.
values.author: George S. Patton
values.authorOccupation: Senior officer of the United States Army

values.authorQuote: The family is one of nature's masterpieces.
values.author: George Santayana
values.authorBirthname: Jorge Agustín Nicolás Ruiz de Santayana y Borrás

values.authorQuote: Those who do not remember the past are condemned to repeat it.
values.author: George Santayana
values.authorBirthname: Jorge Agustín Nicolás Ruiz de Santayana y Borrás

values.authorQuote: It is always pleasant to be urged to do something on the ground that one can do it well.
values.author: George Santayana
values.authorBirthname: Jorge Agustín Nicolás Ruiz de Santayana y Borrás

values.authorQuote: To reform means to shatter one form and to create another; but the two sides of this act are not always equally intended nor equally successful.
values.author: George Santayana
values.authorBirthname: Jorge Agustín Nicolás Ruiz de Santayana y Borrás

values.authorQuote: Graphic design is the paradise of individuality, eccentricity, heresy, abnormality, hobbies and humors.
values.author: George Santayana
values.authorBirthname: Jorge Agustín Nicolás Ruiz de Santayana y Borrás

values.authorQuote: When men and women agree, it is only in their conclusions; their reasons are always different.
values.author: George Santayana
values.authorBirthname: Jorge Agustín Nicolás Ruiz de Santayana y Borrás

values.authorQuote: The world is a perpetual caricature of itself; at every moment it is the mockery and the contradiction of what it is pretending to be.
values.author: George Santayana
values.authorBirthname: Jorge Agustín Nicolás Ruiz de Santayana y Borrás

values.authorQuote: We must welcome the future, remembering that soon it will be the past; and we must respect the past, remembering that it was once all that was humanly possible.
values.author: George Santayana
values.authorBirthname: Jorge Agustín Nicolás Ruiz de Santayana y Borrás

values.authorQuote: To be interested in the changing seasons is a happier state of mind than to be hopelessly in love with spring.
values.author: George Santayana
values.authorBirthname: Jorge Agustín Nicolás Ruiz de Santayana y Borrás

values.authorQuote: Nonsense is so good only because common sense is so limited.
values.author: George Santayana
values.authorBirthname: Jorge Agustín Nicolás Ruiz de Santayana y Borrás

values.authorQuote: To delight in war is a merit in the soldier, a dangerous quality in the captain, and a positive crime in the statesman.
values.author: George Santayana
values.authorBirthname: Jorge Agustín Nicolás Ruiz de Santayana y Borrás

values.authorQuote: Knowledge is not eating, and we cannot expect to devour and possess what we mean. Knowledge is recognition of something absent; it is a salutation, not an embrace.
values.author: George Santayana
values.authorBirthname: Jorge Agustín Nicolás Ruiz de Santayana y Borrás

values.authorQuote: An artist is a dreamer consenting to dream of the actual world.
values.author: George Santayana
values.authorBirthname: Jorge Agustín Nicolás Ruiz de Santayana y Borrás

values.authorQuote: History is a pack of lies about events that never happened told by people who weren't there.
values.author: George Santayana
values.authorBirthname: Jorge Agustín Nicolás Ruiz de Santayana y Borrás

values.authorQuote: My atheism, like that of Spinoza, is true piety towards the universe and denies only gods fashioned by men in their own image, to be servants of their human interests.
values.author: George Santayana
values.authorBirthname: Jorge Agustín Nicolás Ruiz de Santayana y Borrás

values.authorQuote: Only the dead have seen the end of the war.
values.author: George Santayana
values.authorBirthname: Jorge Agustín Nicolás Ruiz de Santayana y Borrás

values.authorQuote: Philosophers are very severe towards other philosophers because they expect too much.
values.author: George Santayana
values.authorBirthname: Jorge Agustín Nicolás Ruiz de Santayana y Borrás

values.authorQuote: For gold is tried in the fire and acceptable men in the furnace of adversity.
values.author: George Santayana
values.authorBirthname: Jorge Agustín Nicolás Ruiz de Santayana y Borrás

values.authorQuote: A child educated only at school is an uneducated child.
values.author: George Santayana
values.authorBirthname: Jorge Agustín Nicolás Ruiz de Santayana y Borrás

values.authorQuote: There is no cure for birth and death save to enjoy the interval.
values.author: George Santayana
values.authorBirthname: Jorge Agustín Nicolás Ruiz de Santayana y Borrás

values.authorQuote: The Difficult is that which can be done immediately; the Impossible that which takes a little longer.
values.author: George Santayana
values.authorBirthname: Jorge Agustín Nicolás Ruiz de Santayana y Borrás

values.authorQuote: Nothing can so pierce the soul as the uttermost sigh of the body.
values.author: George Santayana
values.authorBirthname: Jorge Agustín Nicolás Ruiz de Santayana y Borrás

values.authorQuote: It is a revenge the devil sometimes takes upon the virtuous, that he entraps them by the force of the very passion they have suppressed and think themselves superior to.
values.author: George Santayana
values.authorBirthname: Jorge Agustín Nicolás Ruiz de Santayana y Borrás

values.authorQuote: The great difficulty in education is to get experience out of ideas.
values.author: George Santayana
values.authorBirthname: Jorge Agustín Nicolás Ruiz de Santayana y Borrás

values.authorQuote: One's friends are that part of the human race with which one can be human.
values.author: George Santayana
values.authorBirthname: Jorge Agustín Nicolás Ruiz de Santayana y Borrás

values.authorQuote: To me, it seems a dreadful indignity to have a soul controlled by geography.
values.author: George Santayana
values.authorBirthname: Jorge Agustín Nicolás Ruiz de Santayana y Borrás

values.authorQuote: Terrorist attacks can shake the foundations of our biggest buildings, but they cannot touch the foundation of America. These acts shatter steel, but they cannot dent the steel of American resolve.
values.author: George W. Bush
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, Governor of Taxas

values.authorQuote: Leadership to me means duty, honor, country. It means character, and it means listening from time to time.
values.author: George W. Bush
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, Governor of Taxas

values.authorQuote: The wisest use of American strength is to advance freedom.
values.author: George W. Bush
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, Governor of Taxas

values.authorQuote: There's no bigger task than protecting the homeland of our country.
values.author: George W. Bush
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, Governor of Taxas

values.authorQuote: America is the land of the second chance - and when the gates of the prison open, the path ahead should lead to a better life.
values.author: George W. Bush
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, Governor of Taxas

values.authorQuote: We will not waver; we will not tire; we will not falter, and we will not fail. Peace and Freedom will prevail.
values.author: George W. Bush
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, Governor of Taxas

values.authorQuote: You can fool some of the people all the time, and those are the ones you want to concentrate on.
values.author: George W. Bush
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, Governor of Taxas

values.authorQuote: Freedom itself was attacked this morning by a faceless coward, and freedom will be defended.
values.author: George W. Bush
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, Governor of Taxas

values.authorQuote: Use power to help people. For we are given power not to advance our own purposes nor to make a great show in the world, nor a name. There is but one just use of power and it is to serve people.
values.author: George W. Bush
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, Governor of Taxas

values.authorQuote: To those of you who received honours, awards and distinctions, I say well done. And to the C students, I say you, too, can be president of the United States.
values.author: George W. Bush
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, Governor of Taxas

values.authorQuote: I think you can judge from somebody's actions a kind of a stability and sense of purpose perhaps created by strong religious roots. I mean, there's a certain patience, a certain discipline, I think, that religion helps you achieve.
values.author: George W. Bush
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, Governor of Taxas

values.authorQuote: I have zero desire, just so you know, to be in the limelight. I don't think it's good for the country to have a former president criticize his successor. You're not going to see me giving my opinions in the public arena, until I start selling my book. I'm going to emerge then submerge.
values.author: George W. Bush
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, Governor of Taxas

values.authorQuote: Do I think faith will be an important part of being a good president? Yes, I do.
values.author: George W. Bush
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, Governor of Taxas

values.authorQuote: Only a liberal senator from Massachusetts would say that a 49 percent increase in funding for education was not enough.
values.author: George W. Bush
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, Governor of Taxas

values.authorQuote: On September 11 2001, America felt its vulnerability even to threats that gather on the other side of the Earth. We resolved then, and we are resolved today, to confront every threat from any source that could bring sudden terror and suffering to America.
values.author: George W. Bush
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, Governor of Taxas

values.authorQuote: For diplomacy to be effective, words must be credible - and no one can now doubt the word of America.
values.author: George W. Bush
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, Governor of Taxas

values.authorQuote: The men and women of Afghanistan are building a nation that is free, and proud, and fighting terror - and America is honored to be their friend.
values.author: George W. Bush
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, Governor of Taxas

values.authorQuote: It's clearly a budget. It's got a lot of numbers in it.
values.author: George W. Bush
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, Governor of Taxas

values.authorQuote: If you're sick and tired of the politics of cynicism and polls and principles, come and join this campaign.
values.author: George W. Bush
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, Governor of Taxas

values.authorQuote: America is a Nation with a mission - and that mission comes from our most basic beliefs. We have no desire to dominate, no ambitions of empire. Our aim is a democratic peace - a peace founded upon the dignity and rights of every man and woman.
values.author: George W. Bush
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, Governor of Taxas

values.authorQuote: I'm hopeful. I know there is a lot of ambition in Washington, obviously. But I hope the ambitious realize that they are more likely to succeed with success as opposed to failure.
values.author: George W. Bush
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, Governor of Taxas

values.authorQuote: I will never relent in defending America - whatever it takes.
values.author: George W. Bush
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, Governor of Taxas

values.authorQuote: Hundreds of thousands of American servicemen and women are deployed across the world in the war on terror. By bringing hope to the oppressed, and delivering justice to the violent, they are making America more secure.
values.author: George W. Bush
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, Governor of Taxas

values.authorQuote: It is clear our nation is reliant upon big foreign oil. More and more of our imports come from overseas.
values.author: George W. Bush
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, Governor of Taxas

values.authorQuote: I want to thank you for taking time out of your day to come and witness my hanging.
values.author: George W. Bush
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, Governor of Taxas

values.authorQuote: The resolve of our great nation is being tested. But make no mistake, we will show the world that we will pass the test.
values.author: George W. Bush
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, Governor of Taxas

values.authorQuote: Guard against the impostures of pretended patriotism.
values.author: George Washington
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, one of the Founding Fathers of the United States, Soldier
values.authorBirthplace: Bridges Creek, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: My first wish is to see this plague of mankind, war, banished from the earth.
values.author: George Washington
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, one of the Founding Fathers of the United States, Soldier
values.authorBirthplace: Bridges Creek, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: If the freedom of speech is taken away then dumb and silent we may be led, like sheep to the slaughter.
values.author: George Washington
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, one of the Founding Fathers of the United States, Soldier
values.authorBirthplace: Bridges Creek, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: It is far better to be alone, than to be in bad company.
values.author: George Washington
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, one of the Founding Fathers of the United States, Soldier
values.authorBirthplace: Bridges Creek, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: Observe good faith and justice toward all nations. Cultivate peace and harmony with all.
values.author: George Washington
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, one of the Founding Fathers of the United States, Soldier
values.authorBirthplace: Bridges Creek, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: To be prepared for war is one of the most effective means of preserving peace.
values.author: George Washington
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, one of the Founding Fathers of the United States, Soldier
values.authorBirthplace: Bridges Creek, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: Liberty, when it begins to take root, is a plant of rapid growth.
values.author: George Washington
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, one of the Founding Fathers of the United States, Soldier
values.authorBirthplace: Bridges Creek, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: Truth will ultimately prevail where there is pains to bring it to light.
values.author: George Washington
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, one of the Founding Fathers of the United States, Soldier
values.authorBirthplace: Bridges Creek, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: The Constitution is the guide which I never will abandon.
values.author: George Washington
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, one of the Founding Fathers of the United States, Soldier
values.authorBirthplace: Bridges Creek, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: Discipline is the soul of an army. It makes small numbers formidable; procures success to the weak, and esteem to all.
values.author: George Washington
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, one of the Founding Fathers of the United States, Soldier
values.authorBirthplace: Bridges Creek, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one.
values.author: George Washington
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, one of the Founding Fathers of the United States, Soldier
values.authorBirthplace: Bridges Creek, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: Associate with men of good quality if you esteem your own reputation; for it is better to be alone than in bad company.
values.author: George Washington
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, one of the Founding Fathers of the United States, Soldier
values.authorBirthplace: Bridges Creek, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: Let us with caution indulge the supposition that morality can be maintained without religion. Reason and experience both forbid us to expect that national morality can prevail in exclusion of religious principle.
values.author: George Washington
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, one of the Founding Fathers of the United States, Soldier
values.authorBirthplace: Bridges Creek, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: It may be laid down as a primary position, and the basis of our system, that every Citizen who enjoys the protection of a Free Government, owes not only a proportion of his property, but even of his personal services to the defense of it.
values.author: George Washington
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, one of the Founding Fathers of the United States, Soldier
values.authorBirthplace: Bridges Creek, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: Mankind, when left to themselves, are unfit for their own government.
values.author: George Washington
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, one of the Founding Fathers of the United States, Soldier
values.authorBirthplace: Bridges Creek, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: When we assumed the Soldier, we did not lay aside the Citizen.
values.author: George Washington
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, one of the Founding Fathers of the United States, Soldier
values.authorBirthplace: Bridges Creek, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: Let us raise a standard to which the wise and honest can repair; the rest is in the hands of God.
values.author: George Washington
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, one of the Founding Fathers of the United States, Soldier
values.authorBirthplace: Bridges Creek, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: If we desire to avoid insult, we must be able to repel it; if we desire to secure peace, one of the most powerful instruments of our rising prosperity, it must be known, that we are at all times ready for War.
values.author: George Washington
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, one of the Founding Fathers of the United States, Soldier
values.authorBirthplace: Bridges Creek, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: Arbitrary power is most easily established on the ruins of liberty abused to licentiousness.
values.author: George Washington
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, one of the Founding Fathers of the United States, Soldier
values.authorBirthplace: Bridges Creek, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: Worry is the interest paid by those who borrow trouble.
values.author: George Washington
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, one of the Founding Fathers of the United States, Soldier
values.authorBirthplace: Bridges Creek, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: Be courteous to all, but intimate with few, and let those few be well tried before you give them your confidence.
values.author: George Washington
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, one of the Founding Fathers of the United States, Soldier
values.authorBirthplace: Bridges Creek, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: Experience teaches us that it is much easier to prevent an enemy from posting themselves than it is to dislodge them after they have got possession.
values.author: George Washington
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, one of the Founding Fathers of the United States, Soldier
values.authorBirthplace: Bridges Creek, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: Let your heart feel for the afflictions and distress of everyone, and let your hand give in proportion to your purse.
values.author: George Washington
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, one of the Founding Fathers of the United States, Soldier
values.authorBirthplace: Bridges Creek, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: Happiness and moral duty are inseparably connected.
values.author: George Washington
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, one of the Founding Fathers of the United States, Soldier
values.authorBirthplace: Bridges Creek, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: My observation is that whenever one person is found adequate to the discharge of a duty... it is worse executed by two persons, and scarcely done at all if three or more are employed therein.
values.author: George Washington
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, one of the Founding Fathers of the United States, Soldier
values.authorBirthplace: Bridges Creek, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: It is better to be alone than in bad company.
values.author: George Washington
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, one of the Founding Fathers of the United States, Soldier
values.authorBirthplace: Bridges Creek, Colony of Virginia, British America

values.authorQuote: When you take a flower in your hand and really look at it, it's your world for the moment. I want to give that world to someone else. Most people in the city rush around so, they have no time to look at a flower. I want them to see it whether they want to or not.
values.author: Georgia O'Keeffe
values.authorBirthplace: Town of Sun Prairie, Wisconsin, U.S.

values.authorQuote: Nobody sees a flower really; it is so small. We haven't time, and to see takes time - like to have a friend takes time.
values.author: Georgia O'Keeffe
values.authorBirthplace: Town of Sun Prairie, Wisconsin, U.S.

values.authorQuote: I found I could say things with color and shapes that I couldn't say any other way - things I had no words for.
values.author: Georgia O'Keeffe
values.authorBirthplace: Town of Sun Prairie, Wisconsin, U.S.

values.authorQuote: You get whatever accomplishment you are willing to declare.
values.author: Georgia O'Keeffe
values.authorBirthplace: Town of Sun Prairie, Wisconsin, U.S.

values.authorQuote: To create one's world in any of the arts takes courage.
values.author: Georgia O'Keeffe
values.authorBirthplace: Town of Sun Prairie, Wisconsin, U.S.

values.authorQuote: I decided that if I could paint that flower in a huge scale, you could not ignore its beauty.
values.author: Georgia O'Keeffe
values.authorBirthplace: Town of Sun Prairie, Wisconsin, U.S.

values.authorQuote: I've been absolutely terrified every moment of my life - and I've never let it keep me from doing a single thing I wanted to do.
values.author: Georgia O'Keeffe
values.authorBirthplace: Town of Sun Prairie, Wisconsin, U.S.

values.authorQuote: I have things in my head that are not like what anyone has taught me - shapes and ideas so near to me - so natural to my way of being and thinking that it hasn't occurred to me to put them down.
values.author: Georgia O'Keeffe
values.authorBirthplace: Town of Sun Prairie, Wisconsin, U.S.

values.authorQuote: I had to create an equivalent for what I felt about what I was looking at - not copy it.
values.author: Georgia O'Keeffe
values.authorBirthplace: Town of Sun Prairie, Wisconsin, U.S.

values.authorQuote: It was all so far away - there was quiet and an untouched feel to the country and I could work as I pleased.
values.author: Georgia O'Keeffe
values.authorBirthplace: Town of Sun Prairie, Wisconsin, U.S.

values.authorQuote: I hate flowers - I paint them because they're cheaper than models and they don't move.
values.author: Georgia O'Keeffe
values.authorBirthplace: Town of Sun Prairie, Wisconsin, U.S.

values.authorQuote: The days you work are the best days.
values.author: Georgia O'Keeffe
values.authorBirthplace: Town of Sun Prairie, Wisconsin, U.S.

values.authorQuote: I often lay on that bench looking up into the tree, past the trunk and up into the branches. It was particularly fine at night with the stars above the tree.
values.author: Georgia O'Keeffe
values.authorBirthplace: Town of Sun Prairie, Wisconsin, U.S.

values.authorQuote: I decided to start anew, to strip away what I had been taught.
values.author: Georgia O'Keeffe
values.authorBirthplace: Town of Sun Prairie, Wisconsin, U.S.

values.authorQuote: It was in the 1920s, when nobody had time to reflect, that I saw a still-life painting with a flower that was perfectly exquisite, but so small you really could not appreciate it.
values.author: Georgia O'Keeffe
values.authorBirthplace: Town of Sun Prairie, Wisconsin, U.S.

values.authorQuote: I often painted fragments of things because it seemed to make my statement as well as or better than the whole could.
values.author: Georgia O'Keeffe
values.authorBirthplace: Town of Sun Prairie, Wisconsin, U.S.

values.authorQuote: Anyone who doesn't feel the crosses simply doesn't get that country.
values.author: Georgia O'Keeffe
values.authorBirthplace: Town of Sun Prairie, Wisconsin, U.S.

values.authorQuote: I believe I would rather have Stieglitz like something - anything I had done - than anyone else I know.
values.author: Georgia O'Keeffe
values.authorBirthplace: Town of Sun Prairie, Wisconsin, U.S.

values.authorQuote: I don't very much enjoy looking at paintings in general. I know too much about them. I take them apart.
values.author: Georgia O'Keeffe
values.authorBirthplace: Town of Sun Prairie, Wisconsin, U.S.

values.authorQuote: I know now that most people are so closely concerned with themselves that they are not aware of their own individuality, I can see myself, and it has helped me to say what I want to say in paint.
values.author: Georgia O'Keeffe
values.authorBirthplace: Town of Sun Prairie, Wisconsin, U.S.

values.authorQuote: I feel there is something unexplored about woman that only a woman can explore.
values.author: Georgia O'Keeffe
values.authorBirthplace: Town of Sun Prairie, Wisconsin, U.S.

values.authorQuote: Sun-bleached bones were most wonderful against the blue - that blue that will always be there as it is now after all man's destruction is finished.
values.author: Georgia O'Keeffe
values.authorBirthplace: Town of Sun Prairie, Wisconsin, U.S.

values.authorQuote: Singing has always seemed to me the most perfect means of expression. It is so spontaneous. And after singing, I think the violin. Since I cannot sing, I paint.
values.author: Georgia O'Keeffe
values.authorBirthplace: Town of Sun Prairie, Wisconsin, U.S.

values.authorQuote: I said to myself, I have things in my head that are not like what anyone has taught me - shapes and ideas so near to me - so natural to my way of being and thinking that it hasn't occurred to me to put them down.
values.author: Georgia O'Keeffe
values.authorBirthplace: Town of Sun Prairie, Wisconsin, U.S.

values.authorQuote: One can not be an American by going about saying that one is an American. It is necessary to feel America, like America, love America and then work.
values.author: Georgia O'Keeffe
values.authorBirthplace: Town of Sun Prairie, Wisconsin, U.S.

values.authorQuote: One can't paint New York as it is, but rather as it is felt.
values.author: Georgia O'Keeffe
values.authorBirthplace: Town of Sun Prairie, Wisconsin, U.S.

values.authorQuote: To love means loving the unlovable. To forgive means pardoning the unpardonable. Faith means believing the unbelievable. Hope means hoping when everything seems hopeless.
values.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

values.authorQuote: There are no rules of architecture for a castle in the clouds.
values.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

values.authorQuote: And when it rains on your parade, look up rather than down. Without the rain, there would be no rainbow.
values.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

values.authorQuote: The traveler sees what he sees, the tourist sees what he has come to see.
values.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

values.authorQuote: When it comes to life the critical thing is whether you take things for granted or take them with gratitude.
values.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

values.authorQuote: The way to love anything is to realize that it may be lost.
values.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

values.authorQuote: All architecture is great architecture after sunset; perhaps architecture is really a nocturnal art, like the art of fireworks.
values.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

values.authorQuote: An adventure is only an inconvenience rightly considered. An inconvenience is only an adventure wrongly considered.
values.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

values.authorQuote: Do not free a camel of the burden of his hump; you may be freeing him from being a camel.
values.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

values.authorQuote: An inconvenience is an adventure wrongly considered.
values.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

values.authorQuote: Marriage is an adventure, like going to war.
values.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

values.authorQuote: All slang is metaphor, and all metaphor is poetry.
values.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

values.authorQuote: Compromise used to mean that half a loaf was better than no bread. Among modern statesmen it really seems to mean that half a loaf; is better than a whole loaf.
values.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

values.authorQuote: Journalism is popular, but it is popular mainly as fiction. Life is one world, and life seen in the newspapers is another.
values.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

values.authorQuote: A man who says that no patriot should attack the war until it is over... is saying no good son should warn his mother of a cliff until she has fallen.
values.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

values.authorQuote: There is a great deal of difference between an eager man who wants to read a book and the tired man who wants a book to read.
values.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

values.authorQuote: One sees great things from the valley; only small things from the peak.
values.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

values.authorQuote: The true object of all human life is play. Earth is a task garden; heaven is a playground.
values.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

values.authorQuote: Without education we are in a horrible and deadly danger of taking educated people seriously.
values.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

values.authorQuote: Art consists of limitation. The most beautiful part of every picture is the frame.
values.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

values.authorQuote: Education is simply the soul of a society as it passes from one generation to another.
values.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

values.authorQuote: It isn't that they can't see the solution. It is that they can't see the problem.
values.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

values.authorQuote: Let your religion be less of a theory and more of a love affair.
values.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

values.authorQuote: Love means to love that which is unlovable; or it is no virtue at all.
values.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

values.authorQuote: If I can put one touch of rosy sunset into the life of any man or woman, I shall feel that I have worked with God.
values.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

values.authorQuote: Courage is almost a contradiction in terms. It means a strong desire to live taking the form of readiness to die.
values.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

values.authorQuote: Without leaps of imagination, or dreaming, we lose the excitement of possibilities. Dreaming, after all, is a form of planning.
values.author: Gloria Steinem
values.authorOccupation: Writer and journalist for Ms. and New York magazines[3]

values.authorQuote: A gender-equal society would be one where the word 'gender' does not exist: where everyone can be themselves.
values.author: Gloria Steinem
values.authorOccupation: Writer and journalist for Ms. and New York magazines[3]

values.authorQuote: Being misunderstood by people whose opinions you value is absolutely the most painful.
values.author: Gloria Steinem
values.authorOccupation: Writer and journalist for Ms. and New York magazines[3]

values.authorQuote: The problem for all women is we're identified by how we look instead of by our heads and our hearts.
values.author: Gloria Steinem
values.authorOccupation: Writer and journalist for Ms. and New York magazines[3]

values.authorQuote: A woman without a man is like a fish without a bicycle.
values.author: Gloria Steinem
values.authorOccupation: Writer and journalist for Ms. and New York magazines[3]
