values.author: Jack Ma
values.authorOccupation: Founder and Executive Chairman of Alibaba Group

values.authorQuote: Before I left China, I was educated that China was the richest, happiest country in the world. So when I arrived Australia, I thought, 'Oh my God, everything is different from what I was told.' Since then, I started to think differently.
values.author: Jack Ma
values.authorOccupation: Founder and Executive Chairman of Alibaba Group

values.authorQuote: The world needs new leadership, but the new leadership is about working together.
values.author: Jack Ma
values.authorOccupation: Founder and Executive Chairman of Alibaba Group

values.authorQuote: If Alibaba cannot become a Microsoft or Wal-Mart, I will regret it for the rest of my life.
values.author: Jack Ma
values.authorOccupation: Founder and Executive Chairman of Alibaba Group

values.authorQuote: EBay is a great company. There are a lot of good assets and good customers, and the U.S. people love it.
values.author: Jack Ma
values.authorOccupation: Founder and Executive Chairman of Alibaba Group

values.authorQuote: My dream was to set up my own e-commerce company. In 1999, I gathered 18 people in my apartment and spoke to them for two hours about my vision. Everyone put their money on the table, and that got us $60,000 to start Alibaba. I wanted to have a global company, so I chose a global name.
values.author: Jack Ma
values.authorOccupation: Founder and Executive Chairman of Alibaba Group

values.authorQuote: I try to make myself happy, no, because I know that if I'm not happy, my colleagues are not happy and my shareholders are not happy and my customers are not happy.
values.author: Jack Ma
values.authorOccupation: Founder and Executive Chairman of Alibaba Group

values.authorQuote: I want people to learn what democracy means.
values.author: Jack Ma
values.authorOccupation: Founder and Executive Chairman of Alibaba Group

values.authorQuote: I don't want to be liked. I want to be respected.
values.author: Jack Ma
values.authorOccupation: Founder and Executive Chairman of Alibaba Group

values.authorQuote: A peace talk is always difficult, always complicated.
values.author: Jack Ma
values.authorOccupation: Founder and Executive Chairman of Alibaba Group

values.authorQuote: I don't want people in China to have deep pockets but shallow minds.
values.author: Jack Ma
values.authorOccupation: Founder and Executive Chairman of Alibaba Group

values.authorQuote: I want to change history, do something important in my life, and influence individuals like we have with millions of small businesses on Alibaba. Then they love and respect you because you made their life important.
values.author: Jack Ma
values.authorOccupation: Founder and Executive Chairman of Alibaba Group

values.authorQuote: Chinese people, young people, they don't go shopping a lot in department stores. All department store guys hate me. They say business is bad because of Jack.
values.author: Jack Ma
values.authorOccupation: Founder and Executive Chairman of Alibaba Group

values.authorQuote: I don't shop online, but my wife buys everything at home. We buy sea crabs, fresh crabs, all kinds of things.
values.author: Jack Ma
values.authorOccupation: Founder and Executive Chairman of Alibaba Group

values.authorQuote: The lessons I learned from the dark days at Alibaba are that you've got to make your team have value, innovation, and vision. Also, if you don't give up, you still have a chance. And, when you are small, you have to be very focused and rely on your brain, not your strength.
values.author: Jack Ma
values.authorOccupation: Founder and Executive Chairman of Alibaba Group

values.authorQuote: I think Yahoo is a great company, with great assets.
values.author: Jack Ma
values.authorOccupation: Founder and Executive Chairman of Alibaba Group

values.authorQuote: My job is making money, helping other people make money. I am spending money, trying to make sure more people get rich, because you cannot spend a lot of money, right? So my job is spending money, helping others. This is a headache.
values.author: Jack Ma
values.authorOccupation: Founder and Executive Chairman of Alibaba Group

values.authorQuote: Help young people. Help small guys. Because small guys will be big. Young people will have the seeds you bury in their minds, and when they grow up, they will change the world.
values.author: Jack Ma
values.authorOccupation: Founder and Executive Chairman of Alibaba Group

values.authorQuote: There's an examination for young people to go to university. I failed it three times. I failed a lot. So I applied to 30 different jobs and got rejected. I went for a job with the police; they said, 'You're no good.' I even went to KFC when it came to my city. Twenty-four people went for the job. Twenty-three were accepted.
values.author: Jack Ma
values.authorOccupation: Founder and Executive Chairman of Alibaba Group

values.authorQuote: Today the financial market is no good, but the money is there.
values.author: Jack Ma
values.authorOccupation: Founder and Executive Chairman of Alibaba Group

values.authorQuote: Good business leaders create a vision, articulate the vision, passionately own the vision, and relentlessly drive it to completion.
values.author: Jack Welch

values.authorQuote: Globalization has changed us into a company that searches the world, not just to sell or to source, but to find intellectual capital - the world's best talents and greatest ideas.
values.author: Jack Welch

values.authorQuote: Number one, cash is king... number two, communicate... number three, buy or bury the competition.
values.author: Jack Welch

values.authorQuote: A strategy is something like, an innovative new product; globalization, taking your products around the world; be the low-cost producer. A strategy is something you can touch; you can motivate people with; be number one and number two in every business. You can energize people around the message.
values.author: Jack Welch

values.authorQuote: Control your own destiny or someone else will.
values.author: Jack Welch

values.authorQuote: You've got to eat while you dream. You've got to deliver on short-range commitments, while you develop a long-range strategy and vision and implement it. The success of doing both. Walking and chewing gum if you will. Getting it done in the short-range, and delivering a long-range plan, and executing on that.
values.author: Jack Welch

values.authorQuote: The story about GE that hasn't been told is the value of an informal place. I think it's a big thought. I don't think people have ever figured out that being informal is a big deal.
values.author: Jack Welch

values.authorQuote: The biggest cowards are managers who don't let people know where they stand.
values.author: Jack Welch

values.authorQuote: Be candid with everyone.
values.author: Jack Welch

values.authorQuote: I was never the smartest guy in the room. From the first person I hired, I was never the smartest guy in the room. And that's a big deal. And if you're going to be a leader - if you're a leader and you're the smartest guy in the world - in the room, you've got real problems.
values.author: Jack Welch

values.authorQuote: An organization's ability to learn, and translate that learning into action rapidly, is the ultimate competitive advantage.
values.author: Jack Welch

values.authorQuote: Face reality as it is, not as it was or as you wish it to be.
values.author: Jack Welch

values.authorQuote: If you don't have a competitive advantage, don't compete.
values.author: Jack Welch

values.authorQuote: Giving people self-confidence is by far the most important thing that I can do. Because then they will act.
values.author: Jack Welch

values.authorQuote: My main job was developing talent. I was a gardener providing water and other nourishment to our top 750 people. Of course, I had to pull out some weeds, too.
values.author: Jack Welch

values.authorQuote: There's no such thing as work-life balance. There are work-life choices, and you make them, and they have consequences.
values.author: Jack Welch

values.authorQuote: The idea flow from the human spirit is absolutely unlimited. All you have to do is tap into that well. I don't like to use the word efficiency. It's creativity. It's a belief that every person counts.
values.author: Jack Welch

values.authorQuote: Management is all about managing in the short term, while developing the plans for the long term.
values.author: Jack Welch

values.authorQuote: In order to lead a country or a company, you've got to get everybody on the same page and you've got to be able to have a vision of where you're going. America can't have a vision of health care for everybody, green economy, regulations - can't have a bunch of piece-meal activities. It's got to have a vision.
values.author: Jack Welch

values.authorQuote: If you pick the right people and give them the opportunity to spread their wings and put compensation as a carrier behind it you almost don't have to manage them.
values.author: Jack Welch

values.authorQuote: Any jerk can have short-term earnings. You squeeze, squeeze, squeeze, and the company sinks five years later.
values.author: Jack Welch

values.authorQuote: Willingness to change is a strength, even if it means plunging part of the company into total confusion for a while.
values.author: Jack Welch

values.authorQuote: You measure your people and you take action on those that don't measure up.
values.author: Jack Welch

values.authorQuote: Change before you have to.
values.author: Jack Welch

values.authorQuote: Strong managers who make tough decisions to cut jobs provide the only true job security in today's world. Weak managers are the problem. Weak managers destroy jobs.
values.author: Jack Welch

values.authorQuote: Culture drives great results.
values.author: Jack Welch

values.authorQuote: Whenever I was upset by something in the papers, Jack always told me to be more tolerant, like a horse flicking away flies in the summer.
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: I'll be a wife and mother first, then First Lady.
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: The only routine with me is no routine at all.
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: If you bungle raising your children, I don't think whatever else you do matters very much.
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: I want to live my life, not record it.
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: I don't think there are any men who are faithful to their wives.
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: There are many little ways to enlarge your child's world. Love of books is the best of all.
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: I think the best thing I can do is to be a distraction. A husband lives and breathes his work all day long. If he comes home to more table thumping, how can the poor man ever relax?
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: Even though people may be well known, they hold in their hearts the emotions of a simple person for the moments that are the most important of those we know on earth: birth, marriage and death.
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: A camel makes an elephant feel like a jet plane.
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: Can anyone understand how it is to have lived in the White House and then, suddenly, to be living alone as the President's widow?
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: One must not let oneself be overwhelmed by sadness.
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: I want minimum information given with maximum politeness.
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: The first time you marry for love, the second for money, and the third for companionship.
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: Dear God, please take care of your servant John Fitzgerald Kennedy.
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: Sex is a bad thing because it rumples the clothes.
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: There are two kinds of women, those who want power in the world and those who want power in bed.
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: I don't understand it. Jack will spend any amount of money to buy votes but he balks at investing a thousand dollars in a beautiful painting.
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: What is sad for women of my generation is that they weren't supposed to work if they had families. What were they going to do when the children are grown - watch the raindrops coming down the window pane?
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: I am a woman above everything else.
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: Now, I think that I should have known that he was magic all along. I did know it - but I should have guessed that it would be too much to ask to grow old with and see our children grow up together. So now, he is a legend when he would have preferred to be a man.
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: The children have been a wonderful gift to me, and I'm thankful to have once again seen our world through their eyes. They restore my faith in the family's future.
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: He didn't even have the satisfaction of being killed for civil rights. it had to be some silly little Communist.
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: You have to have been a Republican to know how good it is to be a Democrat.
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: I always wanted to be some kind of writer or newspaper reporter. But after college... I did other things.
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: An Editor becomes kind of your mother. You expect love and encouragement from an Editor.
values.author: Jackie Kennedy
values.authorOccupation: Wife of the President of the United States

values.authorQuote: I'm not concerned with your liking or disliking me... All I ask is that you respect me as a human being.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: A life is not important except in the impact it has on other lives.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: There's not an American in this country free until every one of us is free.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: The way I figured it, I was even with baseball and baseball with me. The game had done much for me, and I had done much for it.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: The most luxurious possession, the richest treasure anybody has, is his personal dignity.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: Life is not a spectator sport. If you're going to spend your whole life in the grandstand just watching what goes on, in my opinion you're wasting your life.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: Baseball is like a poker game. Nobody wants to quit when he's losing; nobody wants you to quit when you're ahead.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: Many people resented my impatience and honesty, but I never cared about acceptance as much as I cared about respect.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: Today, Negroes play on every big league club and in every minor league. With millions of other Negroes in other walks of life, we are willing to stand up and be counted for what we believe in. In baseball or out, we are no longer willing to wait until Judgment Day for equality - we want it here on earth as well as in Heaven.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: The right of every American to first-class citizenship is the most important issue of our time.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: I speak to you only as an American who happens to be an American Negro and one who is proud of that heritage. We ask for nothing special. We ask only that we be permitted to compete on an even basis, and if we are not worthy, then the competition shall, per se, eliminate us.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: This ain't fun. But you watch me, I'll get it done.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: It kills me to lose. If I'm a troublemaker, and I don't think that my temper makes me one, then it's because I can't stand losing. That's the way I am about winning, all I ever wanted to do was finish first.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: Above anything else, I hate to lose.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: Pop flies, in a sense, are just a diversion for a second baseman. Grounders are his stock trade.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: How you played in yesterday's game is all that counts.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: After two years at UCLA, I decided to leave. I was convinced that no amount of education would help a black man get a job.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: I guess you'd call me an independent, since I've never identified myself with one party or another in politics. I always decide my vote by taking as careful a look as I can at the actual candidates and issues themselves, no matter what the party label.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: In all my years of baseball, I have always expected to be traded. I never liked the idea.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: A new breed of Republicans has taken over the GOP. It is a new breed which is seeking to sell to Americans a doctrine which is as old as mankind - the doctrine of racial division, the doctrine of racial prejudice, the doctrine of white supremacy.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: I cannot salute the flag; I know that I am a black man in a white world. In 1972, in 1947, at my birth in 1919, I know that I never had it made.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: I want everybody to understand that I am an American Negro first before I am a member of any political party.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: It would make everything I worked for meaningless if baseball is integrated but political parties were segregated.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: I cannot possibly believe that I have it made while so many black brothers and sisters are hungry, inadequately housed, insufficiently clothed, denied their dignity as they live in slums or barely exist on welfare.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: The old Dodgers were something special, but of my teammates overall, there was nobody like Pee Wee Reese for me.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: I think if we go back and check our record, the Negro has proven beyond a doubt that we have been more than patient in seeking our rights as American citizens.
values.author: Jackie Robinson
values.authorOccupation: Professional baseball second baseman, first African American to play in Major League Baseball

values.authorQuote: The happiness of the bee and the dolphin is to exist. For man it is to know that and to wonder at it.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: The sea, once it casts its spell, holds one in its net of wonder forever.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: Water and air, the two essential fluids on which all life depends, have become global garbage cans.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: The real cure for our environmental problems is to understand that our job is to salvage Mother Nature. We are facing a formidable enemy in this field. It is the hunters... and to convince them to leave their guns on the wall is going to be very difficult.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: When one man, for whatever reason, has the opportunity to lead an extraordinary life, he has no right to keep it to himself.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: People protect what they love.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: However fragmented the world, however intense the national rivalries, it is an inexorable fact that we become more interdependent every day.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: The sea, the great unifier, is man's only hope. Now, as never before, the old phrase has a literal meaning: we are all in the same boat.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: From birth, man carries the weight of gravity on his shoulders. He is bolted to earth. But man has only to sink beneath the surface and he is free.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: A lot of people attack the sea, I make love to it.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: What is a scientist after all? It is a curious man looking through a keyhole, the keyhole of nature, trying to know what's going on.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: We forget that the water cycle and the life cycle are one.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: If we go on the way we have, the fault is our greed and if we are not willing to change, we will disappear from the face of the globe, to be replaced by the insect.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: No sooner does man discover intelligence than he tries to involve it in his own stupidity.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: The awareness of our environment came progressively in all countries with different outlets.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: The sea is the universal sewer.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: No aquarium, no tank in a marine land, however spacious it may be, can begin to duplicate the conditions of the sea. And no dolphin who inhabits one of those aquariums or one of those marine lands can be considered normal.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: It takes generosity to discover the whole through others. If you realize you are only a violin, you can open yourself up to the world by playing your role in the concert.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: Man, of all the animals, is probably the only one to regard himself as a great delicacy.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: The road to the future leads us smack into the wall. We simply ricochet off the alternatives that destiny offers. Our survival is no more than a question of 25, 50 or perhaps 100 years.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: Farming as we do it is hunting, and in the sea we act like barbarians.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: We must plant the sea and herd its animals using the sea as farmers instead of hunters. That is what civilization is all about - farming replacing hunting.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: If we were logical, the future would be bleak, indeed. But we are more than logical. We are human beings, and we have faith, and we have hope, and we can work.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: I believe that national sovereignties will shrink in the face of universal interdependence.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: I am not a scientist. I am, rather, an impresario of scientists.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: The biggest obstacle was mixing abortion with overpopulation. These are two things that have nothing to do with each other.
values.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

values.authorQuote: I love America more than any other country in this world, and, exactly for this reason, I insist on the right to criticize her perpetually.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: It is certain, in any case, that ignorance, allied with power, is the most ferocious enemy justice can have.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: The paradox of education is precisely this - that as one begins to become conscious one begins to examine the society in which he is being educated.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: The most dangerous creation of any society is the man who has nothing to lose.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: When a man asks himself what is meant by action he proves that he isn't a man of action. Action is a lack of balance. In order to act you must be somewhat insane. A reasonably sensible man is satisfied with thinking.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: Everybody's journey is individual. If you fall in love with a boy, you fall in love with a boy. The fact that many Americans consider it a disease says more about them than it does about homosexuality.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: Love takes off masks that we fear we cannot live without and know we cannot live within.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: To be a Negro in this country and to be relatively conscious is to be in a rage almost all the time.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: The power of the white world is threatened whenever a black man refuses to accept the white world's definitions.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: To act is to be committed, and to be committed is to be in danger.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: Love does not begin and end the way we seem to think it does. Love is a battle, love is a war; love is a growing up.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: The world is before you and you need not take it or leave it as it was when you came in.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: People are trapped in history and history is trapped in them.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: Nobody is more dangerous than he who imagines himself pure in heart; for his purity, by definition, is unassailable.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: Anyone who has ever struggled with poverty knows how extremely expensive it is to be poor.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: Children have never been very good at listening to their elders, but they have never failed to imitate them.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: Those who say it can't be done are usually interrupted by others doing it.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: Fires can't be made with dead embers, nor can enthusiasm be stirred by spiritless men. Enthusiasm in our daily work lightens effort and turns even labor into pleasant tasks.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: Love him and let him love you. Do you think anything else under heaven really matters?
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: I imagine one of the reasons people cling to their hates so stubbornly is because they sense, once hate is gone, they will be forced to deal with pain.
values.author: James A. Baldwin
values.authorOccupation: Football player, track athlete, coach of football basketball and baseball

values.authorQuote: Be careful what you set your heart upon - for it will surely be yours.
values.author: James A. Baldwin

values.authorQuote: I love what I do, and when you love what you do, you want to be the best at it.
values.author: Jay-Z

values.authorQuote: I was forced to be an artist and a CEO from the beginning, so I was forced to be like a businessman because when I was trying to get a record deal, it was so hard to get a record deal on my own that it was either give up or create my own company.

values.authorQuote: I think relationships are broken up because of the media.
values.author: Jay-Z

values.authorQuote: I collect art, and I drink wine... things that I like that I had never been exposed to. But I never said, 'I'm going to buy art to impress this crowd.' That's just ridiculous to me. I don't live my life like that, because how could you be happy with yourself?
values.author: Jay-Z

values.authorQuote: The average rap life is two or three albums. You're lucky to get to your second album in rap!

values.authorQuote: Successful people have a bigger fear of failure than people who've never done anything because if you haven't been successful, then you don't know how it feels to lose it all.

values.authorQuote: I've never looked at myself and said that I need to be a certain way to be around a certain sort of people. I've always wanted to stay true to myself, and I've managed to do that. People have to accept that.

values.authorQuote: I'm far from being god, but I work god damn hard.

values.authorQuote: I'm just saying the producers and people who work on music are getting left out - that's when it starts getting criminal. It's like you're working hard, and you're not receiving. In any other business, people would be standing before Congress. They have antitrust laws against this kind of behavior.
values.author: Jay-Z

values.authorQuote: I treat people based on who they really are, not the name. Everyone has to be respectful and be a human being. No one's above... That's how I carry it with anybody.
values.author: Jay-Z

values.authorQuote: I would run into the corner store, the bodega, and just grab a paper bag or buy juice - anything just to get a paper bag. And I'd write the words on the paper bag and stuff these ideas in my pocket until I got back. Then I would transfer them into the notebook.
values.author: Jay-Z

values.authorQuote: Rosa Parks sat so Martin Luther King could walk. Martin Luther King walked so Obama could run. Obama's running so we all can fly.
values.author: Jay-Z

values.authorQuote: Racism is taught in the home. We agree on that? Well, it's very hard to teach racism to a teenager who's listening to rap music and who idolizes, say, Snoop Dogg. It's hard to say, 'That guy is less than you.' The kid is like, 'I like that guy, he's cool. How is he less than me?
values.author: Jay-Z

values.authorQuote: That's why this generation is the least racist generation ever. You see it all the time. Go to any club. People are intermingling, hanging out, having fun, enjoying the same music. Hip-hop is not just in the Bronx anymore. It's worldwide. Everywhere you go, people are listening to hip-hop and partying together. Hip-hop has done that.
values.author: Jay-Z

values.authorQuote: Successful people have a bigger fear of failure than people who've never done anything because if you haven't been successful, then you don't know how it feels to lose it all. You don't have that fear. So why do you think people get stuck in those boxes? It's that fear of going back down.
values.author: Jay-Z

values.authorQuote: Primarily I see myself as so much more than a rapper. I really believe I am the voice for a lot of people who don't have that microphone or who can't rap.

values.authorQuote: The goal of education is not to increase the amount of knowledge but to create the possibilities for a child to invent and discover, to create men who are capable of doing new things.
values.author: Jean Piaget

values.authorQuote: The principle goal of education in the schools should be creating men and women who are capable of doing new things, not simply repeating what other generations have done.
values.author: Jean Piaget

values.authorQuote: The child often sees only what he already knows. He projects the whole of his verbal thought into things. He sees mountains as built by men, rivers as dug out with spades, the sun and moon as following us on our walks.

values.authorQuote: It is with children that we have the best chance of studying the development of logical knowledge, mathematical knowledge, physical knowledge, and so forth.

values.authorQuote: Play is the work of childhood.
values.author: Jean Piaget

values.authorQuote: Logic and mathematics are nothing but specialised linguistic structures.

values.authorQuote: To express the same idea in still another way, I think that human knowledge is essentially active.

values.authorQuote: The self thus becomes aware of itself, at least in its practical action, and discovers itself as a cause among other causes and as an object subject to the same laws as other objects.

values.authorQuote: Play is the answer to the question, 'How does anything new come about?'

values.authorQuote: I always like to think on a problem before reading about it.

values.authorQuote: Intelligence is what you use when you don't know what to do: when neither innateness nor learning has prepared you for the particular situation.

values.authorQuote: During the earliest stages the child perceives things like a solipsist who is unaware of himself as subject and is familiar only with his own actions.

values.authorQuote: Every acquisition of accommodation becomes material for assimilation, but assimilation always resists new accommodations.

values.authorQuote: From the moral as from the intellectual point of view, the child is born neither good nor bad but master of his destiny.

values.authorQuote: Knowing reality means constructing systems of transformations that correspond, more or less adequately, to reality.

values.authorQuote: This means that no single logic is strong enough to support the total construction of human knowledge.

values.authorQuote: The more the schemata are differentiated, the smaller the gap between the new and the familiar becomes, so that novelty, instead of constituting an annoyance avoided by the subject, becomes a problem and invites searching.

values.authorQuote: Egocentrism appears to us as a form of behavior intermediate between purely individual and socialized behavior.

values.authorQuote: Scientific knowledge is in perpetual evolution; it finds itself changed from one day to the next.

values.authorQuote: The current state of knowledge is a moment in history, changing just as rapidly as the state of knowledge in the past has ever changed and, in many instances, more rapidly.

values.authorQuote: Our problem, from the point of view of psychology and from the point of view of genetic epistemology, is to explain how the transition is made from a lower level of knowledge to a level that is judged to be higher.

values.authorQuote: The end is the beginning of all things, Suppressed and hidden, Awaiting to be released through the rhythm Of pain and pleasure.

values.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

values.authorQuote: One is never afraid of the unknown; one is afraid of the known coming to an end.
values.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

values.authorQuote: We all want to be famous people, and the moment we want to be something we are no longer free.
values.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

values.authorQuote: When you call yourself an Indian or a Muslim or a Christian or a European or anything else, you are being violent. Do you see why it is violent? Because you are separating yourself from the rest of mankind. When you separate yourself by belief, by nationality, by tradition, it breeds violence.
values.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

values.authorQuote: Behind every great man is a woman rolling her eyes.
values.author: Jim Carrey

values.authorQuote: A lot of good love can happen in ten years.
values.author: Jim Carrey
values.authorOccupation: Actor, stand-up comedian, screenwriter, film producer

values.authorQuote: If you aren't in the moment, you are either looking forward to uncertainty, or back to pain and regret.

values.authorOccupation: Actor, stand-up comedian, screenwriter, film producer

values.authorQuote: It is better to risk starving to death then surrender. If you give up on your dreams, what's left?
